content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
Product received for free
												Wanna know what red crucible is like, and in particular, their dev team?I've been banned from the red crucible discussion board for a post I made. Originally I made a thread titled "Why pay money for this" and I basically asked why should anyone pay to buy custom guns and gear that you cant use because theres only a dozen servers and theyre always not only full, but got EXTRA people in them waiting for slots to open up. They let 4 extra people join a full server to wait for someone to leave and the first to click "join team" gets to play. So I asked, and a dev named kazdonut responded with: "Its a free to play game. Dont want to pay? Alright. Thanks for checking out Red Crucible."So I responded to that, with:I'd like to show everyone, the dev shows his exact feelings regarding the playerbase and the game in his comment, which i quote (emphasis added)"Its a free to play game. Dont want to PAY? Alright. Thanks for checking out Red Crucible."He and the rest of the developers dont care about the bugs, about the hackers, about the stupidly OP melee, the lack of servers, he doesnt give two ♥♥♥♥s about anything but your money. Just money. The DEVELOPER who responded didnt address my complaint at all. And its just one, of many complaints, that the developers dont give a fu.ck about.They don't care if theres no servers to play on, they don't care about the bugs or the ridiculously overpowered weapons (they care about those actually, since theyre for sale), they don't care about the hackers, they dont care that a quarter of the time i'm driving a vehicle it flips upside down, the devs dont care about any of that except your money.The developers basically said "well its 'done', It's time to get paid! Now lets just sit back and rake in the cash!" And that's their stance on red crucible. They cant be fu.cked to write a single line of code anymore if it isnt for a chest with a special gun in it.kazdonut is right. It IS a free to play game. And that's what it should remain. Free. You're an idiot if you spend any money on this and an a.sshole for rewarding their laziness.And now I'm permanently banned from their message board for "griefing." They had to shut me up, you see, I might cost them a dollar. Do yourself a favor, skip this turd, and if you must play it, dont pay a cent for it, cause everything is ridiculously overpriced (20 dollars to unlock an attack helicopter) and the devs will laugh at your stupid a.ss for giving them money. Don't give them money. Theyre human garbage.UPDATE 5/6: I forgot to mention, I hope you speak spanish, because everyone else in the game does. Good luck communicating to the rest of the server theres a hacker if you dont speak spanish. Why does everyone speak spanish? I suspect because its a free game, and because the devs cant be bothered to pay for any dedicated servers so theres nowhere for them to go. Also, as of today, theyve introduced a new gun. The badger grenade launcher. This truly ups the pay 2 win factor of the game by a couple degrees. The grenade launcher is devastating. One hit kill while youre behind cover, shoot it through a window, whatever. Supposedly it doesnt even arc, the grenades go right where you point them. So you dont even need the skill to kill a guy in a room through a window. The guy with one in the server was destroying our team. By introducing that gun and making it completely unbalanced for anyone without lots of cash to flush away, the devs have unequivocally proven they dont care about their game, just money. On the plus side, if you have lots of money to spare, this is a great game. Several hundred though. Remember, the devs love money.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												What is Red Crucible (Registered Trademark): Firestorm? Budget Pay-2-Win Call of Duty.It's a generic, ugly, boring, poor-man's military shooter that does absolutely nothing new. Everything it does has been done before and much MUCH better. -Pay-2-Win shop with premium currency for better weapons.-Graphics are atrocious and the frame rate stutters.-No imagination with weapons/vehicles. Just generic copy-paste rifles and jeeps.-Riddled with bugs reflecting of lazy design and horrible collision detection.-Objects clip in to each other and cause visual errors.-Animations are slow and clunky,-Combat is boring and slow-paced with no real options besides "point gun and shoot".The game is so generic that if you've played any military shooter from the last decade you've seen the entirety of this game. Don't waste your time or your money when you could be playing something identical to this except better quality.

number of helpful: 157 of 216 people (73%) found this review helpful17 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												I took my time with the game and I like what I see.I'll list the positives and negatives. + The gameplay is smooth and enjoyable+ Most vehicles control well and it takes only a few moments to get used to them+ Teamwork is encouraged+ The game is not won by kills but by completing the objectives+ Runs on old and new computers+ A free game to play that is actually good+ Not pay to win+ Give a taste of the abilities enabled in the game (airstrikes are the best)+ Almost no lag+ Has a transition between first person and third person+ Only about 1gb download- The points system is ridiculous for prices of different weapons, abilities, etc.- The majority of unlockables need some serious time investment (like 3 hours just for a different class)- Vehicles are locked with no transport helicopters available at all- The community doesn't interact well (may change in the future)- Game glitches, has bugs and may crash- Not many people playing at the moment- Maps are locked- Mediocre graphics It may be mediocre in the graphics department but the game certainly has some good gameplay, interesting vehicles and an enjoyable experience. I will edit this to a recommendation if they decide to be easier with the advancement as I can't recommend playing this game for so long when there is barely any reward in doing so. It would have fared better with a pay model rather than being free to play in my opinion. If you want a free game to satisfy that new FPS urge, this isn't as fast paced as COD, MOH or BF so it will not be for you.If you're a fan of the older type of BF and shooters, this is a good appetizer.

content:
Posted: February 25, 2016
												'Red Crucible: Firestorm' is Pay-to-Win. It has it's moments when it displays what it could potentially otherwise be but it can't hide the fact that success in this game, to a degree, can be purchased.Premium weapons (those which are required to be bought and aren't achievable through natural game play) is the literal death of competetive matches in Red Crucible. They far out-weigh all other weapons in performance yet are accessible to anyone willing to fork out the cash. Amusingly, the devs of Red Crucible could argue that these weapons are 'theoretically' attainable by even the cheapest prick through the game credits accumulated by in-game play. However, anyone who may have played the game before will vouch that these credits (or coins) are ridiculously difficult to obtain in a mass large enough to purchase a premium weapon.In early stages (1 - 20) a player may not notice the severe advantage a premium weapon presents to their opponent, simple skills and tactics being more than enough to equalize the disparity. It is only upon reaching levels 20 - 26 that it becomes abrupty apparent, making these levels the hardest to level up from and compete in. It is only now, after many hours wasted, that I find myself in a position to compete against anybody without the asistance of a premium gun. I rather enjoyed the game to be honest, the matches are generally competetive and fun. Yet it is on pure principle that I can't recommend this game to anyone. Red Crucible: Firestorm isn't designed to reward effort, nor hours, and certainly not skill, but the amount of cash a kid is willing to steal from their parents. 5/10: I still play the game so can't hate too much.

												Could have been an ok game.Pros-- Cool customisation and designs of models. No random cleavage, just real military stuff.- The sound design of weapons is fine, it fits the game.- The gameplay is just enjoyable as an early 2000s shooter.But apparently an early 2000s shooter game is better than this.Cons -Game feels very unpolished/ unfinished:- I don't complain about the graphics, but what i do complain is the lack of effects this game has e.g. no bullet puffs when bullets hit surfaces i.e you won't even know if someone is shooting at you from a distance.- Pay to win. You''ll get an M16 as a starter while those able to pay will have high calibre rifles with holographic sights (which helps alot in this game)- Aiming feels clunky and unsmooth, it's only possible to aim people at close range.- You have to unlock maps wtf? Who would wanna stay and play and unlock maps?- Limited amount of grenades per day???- Spawn system of maps is putrid. There's chokepoints from spawn points, so enemy team can literally just stick around in front of your spawn point and shoot you down.- Along with spawning system is the map design is also putrid. In deathmatch games the maps are basically like 3 hallow streets/ buildings that both team rush head on.- Lack of details e.g no props / designs inside buildings.- Boring voice acting

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								TLDR: Would be good if the devs shaped up and stopped being lax. Reeks of intense laziness, but it downloads fast enought to warrant a try.              This game has potential, but that's about it. If the devs want this game to remain competitive on the steam market they have to eliminate the pay2win garbage they use currently. They release weapons that are completely better than the weapons you are provided with, and you have no way to compete against wallet warriors. At the moment it comes across as a crappy battlefield clone, and has unoriginal gameplay. The game is badly optimized and has very unstable fps. The ui reeks of laziness, and the recoil and reload animations feel like you are shooting an airsoft gun. Textures are not well made, and look the same on medium, high, and very high settings. Your sensitivity is lowered a ton when you begin to sprint, and you cannot change your bindings. Still a small download file, so try it out nonetheless. If the devs shaped up then this would be one of the best games on steam.

content:
Posted: February 20
												So when I played the browser version of CR2 I loved it. Then one day I logged on to find CRF. I'm like WTF is this. So I stop playing becasue I was so mad that I had just lost all of my progress. Then a few months ago I decided ti play RCF. I found out it was on steam,  so I downloaded it on steam. In RC2 I could get 120 FPS on high graphics with 12 to 53 ping. Now I get 40 FPS on low graphics and 120 to 350 ping. So that's why I don't play the RC series anymore because they ruiened it as soon as RCF came out. So Devs if you read this maybe you should take RC2 out of the back of your computer storage and put it back up so the people who liked it can play it. Also in the browser version of RC2 there was no chance of crashing unless your browser. Now in RCF I can maybe get one match in before it crashes. So all in all I think that they should relaunch RC2 as a standalone game. I didn't sit hear for 30 min of my Monday morning just so this could be reveiwed then forgotten. So take this into consideration I'm sure many people will agree.

content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
												Well first off, I'd like to say this game has so much potential to be a good game, but currently RGS, or Rocketeer Games Studios is a bit behind. Right off the bat, I'd say, don't get this game. Its not worth it. But here are my pros and cons. Pros:-Unlockable sections for free to play players-Active devs that look into our suggestions and complaints-Fun maps-Vehicles maps, tanks, APCs, helis are used in this game -A variety of outfits, but sometimes, they don't have the stuff I haveCons:-In terms of gameplay, it is a gun and run type or game. Its no fun because there are people with no skills and its aweful. -Terrible spawn system. it was fine at first, but then RGS just butchered it. Its just spawn in and die immediately. Its either spawn camp or be spawn camped. -Unrealistic physics, tanks would just flip over on a ground that has a 12 degree angle-50 cal snipers aren't even 1 shot kill to the chest, you will need to use gun boost, which is extremely over powered in this game. -Somewhat but mostly pay to win. Especially in vehicle matches, gold class tanks, helis, etc are over powered. Such as the KA Alligator, or guns such as the Saiga-12, aka the Automatic Shotgun sniper and the Hellrasier which is no longer aviable for purchase anymore, thank god because the Hellrasier is so OP. -Community is terrible, although I blame RGS for letting this happen, So many cheaters, hacker, and anything new such as missions, we say no because of cheaters, so RCF has a bad reputation when it comes to cheaters-White dot servers, hackers can still continue to play because they get another chance but shoving them in a hacker lobby. But farmers or glitchers just get straight banned. Devs proirities aren't straight.-V mode, very nooby, third person user = camper- Lots of bugs and glitches, although RGS is doing their job by fixing them, they need a lot of work becuase most of them are annoying

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								After playing the venerable Red Crucible 2 for many years, I can easily one of the worst games I've ever played.How this was made into an entire game and taken out of the browser I have no idea.First off, a quick history lesson.RC:F is the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ child of Red Crucible 2 and Battlefield. RC:F was made as a direct replacement for RC2, removing the latter from Kongregate and their website. Sucks to suck if you put any money into RC2. RC:F features better graphics (yes, it's possible), better maps (well...), better vehicles, more lag, and the same ridiculous amount of Brazilians.PROS:+Graphics (Compared to RC2)+Vehicles (They actually did a pretty good job here. Well, good for them.)+Map sizes+-Weapon choicesCONS:-Performance. 40FPS on min while running GTA:V at 115FPS-Connection is so bad. Shooting through walls.-Pay to Win.-Vehicle driving.-Most weapons are pretty much reskins.-Everything is bland.-Animations-Map and texture glitches.-It's just RC2 but everything is reskinned and made 100% worse.-This♥♥♥♥♥♥replaced RC2.-This♥♥♥♥♥♥took RC2 off the internet.-This♥♥♥♥♥♥exists.-Ammo: A new feature in RC:F is ammo counters. Cool beans right? Well limited ammo hasn't existed in Red Crucible ever until this installation, and alot of vets are pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mad. And for good reason. We're used to being able to use suppressing fire and being able to shoot in peace, not to mention the unlimited reserve ammo was a staple of the series. Now we get three mags. Three. These weapons fire so damn fast and can glitch out and even fire twice at once. There goes all of your ammo.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2016
												If you don't have a good pc and money to afford Battlefield 4 then you can play this instead.It's kinda buggy, could be better optimized, don't know about p2w as I have not spent enough time in game.Hitreg seems fine for me, claymores are pretty usefull, mp5 sniper rifle is idk. weird?mp5 snipor reifol - that was the thing that made me drop that game but after that you can unlock M21 so it's good.Also this one was on facebook first so that made me feel uneasy too but I find it nice to play free battlefieldesque game.+There are some good shooters on fb like Contract Wars and one game with zombies that is a single player one, it's called Dead Trigger 2 so there is no need to fear this game as it is one of those games that are the highest quality ones on facebook.Try it, it's free and if you don't like it you can pretty much uninstall it.EDIT1: I have played about 5 hours or so and I have checked every mode except Survival, you have modes where you can use vehicles + infrantry and modes where you play as infrantry only.You also have missions that you can activate and by completing those you can get exp and honors (honors is the ingame currency) you can even unlock some vehicles for completing missions! You can get some exp and money from Achievements aswell but you don't need to activate them or something.So far, so good. I haven't seen any hackers, bug abusers and I have seen some people with weapons and vehicles from item shop xD They were kinda meh, there was a guy with IS gun on the other team and he was on 5th place in his team and there was a guy with your standard m16 rifle and he was the first one.I will update the review when I'll have more to add.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Well, this game is good, but only if we talking about early access game. I think it has a future, but only if developers will work hard with this game.It is really like Battlefield for slow PCs. However, it has bad optimization for bad PCs, my PC is peace of♥♥♥♥♥♥now (Intel Core i3 1.4 GGz with Intel Graphics 3000), but it easilly can run Warface on minimum settings without lags (but with long load screens), but when we talking about this game, I see completelly random lags, they aren't depending on locations, map, they are just... Random.Well, I said it's BF for slow PCs? Well, not really. There are very big amount of guns, but they are not customisable, there are no upgrades like silencers or scopes, only "class" upgrade (just upgrade of damage, accuracy, etc). There are 4 classes, like in BF, but only if we talk about amount. Itself there are completelly different classes. There are only Rifleman and Sniper from BF classes, but Rifleman can use shotgun (there is only one shotgun I found with the name "Shotgun", genius), and Sniper can use really ANYTHING with the scope (even your first weapon will be not a sniper rifle, but MP5 with scope, genius too). New classes are Support (Medic) and Demolition (Engineer). Support is completelly imbalanced class, it doesn't use shotguns, it uses machineguns, and in this game mechanics of MG is the same as mechanics of Assault Rifles, but MG has got much more bullets in magazine (AK-74 has 20, RPK-74 has 50). So why we even need Rifleman when we can play Support? Next is almost useless Demolition. He has got grenade launchers as primary weapon, but there aren't a lot of them, they are hard to get (for second you need 5th level, I'm still 4th, it's hard to level-up here), and only one of them in the shop is for in-game money, others are for "donation". First weapon from this class is RPG-7, but it can't destroy tank from two shots and has got only 5 bullets! As you understood, there are hard to see player with this class.Next is the worst, only 4 vechiels. Even less than in BF:H. I looked in the shop, in upgrades, but no, there aren't buyable vechiels. I promise you, if situation will not change after early access, I will just not reccomend this game.In-app purchases and the balance aren't so much scary before you will see ♥♥♥♥♥♥-support that pwning all your team with top machinegun or nerd-rifleman with Groza, that need one-two shoots to kill. Off cource, you can buy this machinegun for in game money, but first - some weapons are just premium and buyable only for gold (we recieve only 10 gold per level, but as I said, it's too hard to level-up and this MG cost 1,000 gold), second - we recieve 10-100 in-game points per round, but this MG costs 100,000 I-GP. Oh, we can level-up and by Groza, it's cheap, but am I need to say again about level-ups?So now the game is pretty much poor, but I liked it, it is fun to play. Can't wait to see non-early access release. Don't make me sad, developers!

content:
Posted: April 12
												It has been almost 4 years since I played this game. The old version of this game is called red crucible 2 and it updated to Firestorm version about 2 years ago.   This is a fun game with multiple gameplay (including infantry matches, vehichle mathes and diverse modes) and the graphics is okay. However, it is totally a P2W game, which is extremely unbalanced. A stupid premium weapon in this game costs you about 20$ or even more. Some of these weapens are OP because there are huge differences between premium weapon and common one. You can not fight against the players who have premium or legendary weopons unless you buy one as well. So if you don't wanna get your♥♥♥♥♥kicked, you better buy the freaking weapons.    I play this game occasionally and i found that there are fewer and fewer players in this game, most of my friends quit this game. The standard that determines a game is successful or not is whether the free players enjoy it. Free players are critical part in a game, only if they have the good gaming experience, the game can attract more players and make them stay. I hope the develpers could realize it.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								OK So this game is about 50/50 the game itself is AMAIZING if you can get over the poor sound quality and the outdated graphics the GAMEPLAY is awesome. It's a little bit of a grind to unlock stuff like wepons and i THINK you have to buy armer i am not to sure . TDM and a Conquest (battlefield refrence) like gamemode witch the name i cannot remmember are included as well as other classic game modes such as the bomb planting game mode and such. There is Vehecles in the game such as tanks and heli's ecetera ecetera some of the maps are really well designed and are interesting. Over all the game itself is a verry good game and i WOULD rate it 8/10 just for that. HOWEVER there is one bad side witch you get with every game nowdays. The players. Spawn camping is rediculous in this game, for TDM i cant really blame it with the maps being smaller than justin biebers♥♥♥♥♥♥♥but even in the conquest game mode thingy it's a bit one sided for most of the game . there is no team voip so team comunicaition is almost non exsistant and even when you do type the chat box is so small most people do not even read it combined with the fact that everyone is just out for their own and ignore you anyway. IF people worked as a team insted of doing their own thing or relentless spawn camping this game ( if you can ignore outdated graphics and sound) was one of the most fun games i have played in a long time, i started playing at like 9pm and when i checked my phone "ten minuites later" it was 2 am. you will easilly get stuck into this game and with that being said i really do recomend it.To get the best play experience out of this game i would probably get a bunch of freinds and use some sort of voice comunicaition to use team work. playing solo can be kind of frustrating as theres slim to no team work.Some bonus things that i personally found interesting. there is 4 different classes +Sniper+Assault+Support+Demolitions The characters don't really change their looks witch i found interesting as you have to customise your own character and have to change the looks yourself. and it adds variation to the game reguardless that most people go assault of support. There is items that you save up for and can buy like med kits, grenades, spawn points, air strikes, the list goes on and it's a fairly decent list at that. and best of all most of the items are all usefull and not some random crap you wont ever use . thus making you select your items carefully. If you are still reading this then to shorten all of this:Worth the Download: Yes i would say so. it is only a half hour download ( Australian net ) and there is allot of items to buy with ingame cash you earn , the maps are well designed tho some are a little small, there is Vehicles , A medium variety to guns, Character customisaition , and allot of potential if you have freinds.Reasons not to buy: There is a rediculous ammount of spawn camping thus you may rage quit being put up against experienced players . There probably could be a few more bigger maps. if graphics are a big thing to you these graphics are a little out dated and there isn't much in the way of sound fx witch for me is a little boring but not a big problem.You will like this game with friends . solo may be tough. thank you for reading and i hope you have a good gaming experience should you choose to Download it.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I don't write reviews often, but when I do, I have to be playing the single most ♥♥♥♥♥iest game that looked promising but failed to deliver.To start, it looks like it was made with Unity and runs like it too, and it's not helping it any that it took me like 6 minutes to download, and this isn't even my gaming computer!The frame rate is smooth (Because of the PlayStation 1 Graphics) and it's got the very very basics of an FPS, it's got micro transactions coming out the wazoo.I played basic training when I hopped in, greeted by a stereotypical redneck. It's really appalling when the game tells me how to look around and move in an FPS in 2015...anyways the training is like MW2s training only not as good and when you shoot the gun sounds like a very shy man whispering to his crush in a library in the Queen of England's presence while every celebrity in the world rides by in a gold-plated Limosine offering him a job as an actor who only has to ever say 1 word and gets 50 trillion dollars.Turning the camera is a chore and it slides all over the ♥♥♥♥ing place. This game is buggy as hell and broken to♥♥♥♥♥♥ (Might I add the tanks are so ♥♥♥♥ing smooth and quick it's like your piloting the world's fastest space ship except you can't aim the gun down and regular bullets do damage to your armor.)The Textures on the very high setting are worse than Half-Life 1's textures on the lowest setting and worst resolution.I ♥♥♥♥ed with my character customization to find everything looked like♥♥♥♥♥♥ and played one match only to find I had no choice what gamemode I wanted, or even play until the game previously started finished. And even then the game was♥♥♥♥♥♥ I killed everyone because they had dial up connections, flipped my tank over after crashing it into a friendly jeep just to be a♥♥♥♥♥♥to the driver, and then got my♥♥♥♥♥♥kicked in when my tank ran out of ammo. And there's different classes but they're all pretty much useless, save for assault, wich is the only one anybody competent ♥♥♥♥ing uses.Worst game of the month, not worth the 715.7 KB it takes up, go get Heroes and Generals instead if you're looking for a good game like this. Go buy Day of Defeat! Or just play another round of CTF in TF2!EDIT: Alright, so I played a bit more, and it got worse. Obviously in the trailer they HAD to be showing another game, no way, NONE of the guns shown in the trailer fire smoothly like that, and it talks about destructible environments...yeah, sure. That's why someone in a house (One of the ONLY two houses you can go in on that map) Was able to shoot my tank and have it do DAMAGE with an M16, and when I shot next to him it A: Didn't do splash damage so it didn't hurt him and B: Did NOT make even a mark on the wall next to him I hit.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2016
												Back in 2012, when Red Crucible 2 was actually good. It was a free to play game, not many people spent money on weapons or custom loadouts, then when Firestorm came along, Rocketeer just ruined it all.Red Crucible Firestorm is just as upsetting the day it was initially released. This game was and still is actually horrible compared to Red Crucible 2, not trying to say that Red Crucible 2 sucked, it was fun. Lots of things bother me in Firestorm more than it did in RC2. For instance, the one thing that bothers me the most in this game is the field of view.I noticed the field of view is much more lower than it was in RC2, may I suggest adding an FOV slider? This would probably make thousands of other players happy too.Another thing, the gameplay itself. The gameplay is laggy, the maps are not the same as they used to be, and the sprinting is awful. Could you also maybe lower the prices of purchasing Coins too? Even in Red Crucible 2, Coins were expensive, and unfortunately they still are. For me, purchasing 5000 Coins would be around $50. Rocketeer, are you all about money? Some of us people have to work hard everyday. This money is not easy to come across.Before I finish this short review off, I just wanted to mention one last thing about this game. Since Red Crucible 2 was updated to Firestorm, it's also very upsetting to see that this is only a Multiplayer game and not Singleplayer as well. I would have more fun playing this in Singleplayer.Multiplayer is the worst thing compared to FOV in this game, like seriously. The community and the players are totally disrespectful. Not to mention, the fact that this game has lots of Negative reviews is because of the community itself. For years of playing on servers, It's so rare to find someone else that speaks English in the game. I'm always playing with a bunch of foreigners and I don't understand the language their using in the chat clearly.I'm not sure if this game is exactly set to be in America, because lots of Brasilian, Russian, and Japanese people play this game, speaking in their own fluent language besides English. This really bothers me.Furthermore, if a newb were to join a server for the first time, a Level 1 usually, he/she will not be welcomed by anyone at all. Everyone on the server will stay quiet and pretend nothing happened, thus making the player leave. Maybe these people need to be a bit more respectful to others and greet the newbies to the game if it's their first time?And a wrap-up, some of the players on servers are either just straight up hackers or trollers. I am constantly getting killed in the safezone by the enemy team when I'm not even stepping out of the safezone, getting killed by the same player, over and over again, while he is spamming the chat saying "Jaja n00b!". These guys often will speedhack in the map, have godmode, or just having infinite ammo and killing everyone on the other team. Rocketeer Games, fix your stupid game. Stop sitting back and asking us for money to pay for expensive Coins that won't improve your game at all. If you see Mixed reviews on Steam, do something about it. People are writing Negative things about your game, including I. Gameplay is buggy, players are unfriendly, and you guys are just asking for money. If this game actually gets fixed back to when it was actually fun, I will play this once again.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 15
												This is a game you'll go on to love and hate.The developers seem to be non existent, they just pull a Valve on us. They add grapgical and sound updates, and it's 100% pay to win game.The thing is, there are a lot of broken things in this game, such as the T-55 tank, which is more of a bouncy castle than a tank.However, you can just buy a ♥♥♥♥♥on of coins and special store only tanks and hey look at that, you're OP and nobody can touch you.The thing is though, if you have a good team in this game, your tank can't do♥♥♥♥♥♥ The Anti-Vehicle Mine will♥♥♥♥♥♥any tank that goes over it, or destroy it in one good blow. So you've got that going for you.But then there's the server that loves to kick you for no reason, even if you suicide because you can't change your loadout while alive!Oh but then there's more, there are hackers, everywhere. The difference between this game and CS:GO is that the hackers actually get banned instead of staying.However, if you wanna use the votekick, you can't. Nobody speak english so they have no idea what to press, and it requires a ridiculous ammount of people to kick someone. If more than half the people vote yes, kick them! Don't be like CS:GO and make everyone have to vote yes!Oh yeah, there's also no respect in this game. Nobody respects the art of war, nobody will honor you in any way.Then there's the ridiculous spawn protection. The ♥♥♥♥ing spawn can be camped indefinitely with an artillery making it so that you cannot kill them, but they can launch rockets halfway across the map and destroy your will to live. And instead of the devs having half a brain and thinking, "Hold on, let's make it so that if the person in spawn fires their weapon in any way, they can take damage." They just make a giant ♥♥♥♥ing circle in where if the enemy goes into, you can't do any damage to them. So every team has that going for them.And the weapons, the ♥♥♥♥ing weapons man.The UZI which is a secondary is actually well balanced, it's the only balanced weapon. The ASVAL is OP, you can't beat it if you've got good aim, I don't even bother to unlock any other weapon, the ASVAL is 3 bullets to death, and 1 shot to the head to death. So yeah, considering it's full auto you can destroy a mob of enemies without even trying. The weapon spread is also terrible, if you use your sights, no spread whatsoever (this makes literally no sense) but then you've got using no sights, which = your bullets can go in any direction, most never go straight. Oh yeah! If you pull out a grenade while running after pulling out a weapon, the ♥♥♥♥ing weapon's spread goes to the grenade as well, this also goes for the following: planting mines, planting claymores, basically using anything that you have to use the grenade/use key for.Also, never use helicopters, they don't work at all except for transport.So why do I recommend this game if it's basically one giant bug pile?Think of it this way, this game is it's own sort of perfectly imperfect world.There is nobody who is more or lesser than one another. If you play as a team and play the objectives (which nobody does, and team 1 (blue) always ♥♥♥♥ing wins), then you'll actually have a good time.You might not understand any of the 34 languages people speak in this game, but that's okay you'll still yell at eachother no matter what.As I was saying though, the enemy as all these bugs against you, and you have them all against the enemy, so go ahead and plant mines everywhere and decimate the enemy.I've never hated and loved a game more, but if I'm honest, you have to play it to get anything I'm saying here, so do that it's a small download and definitely worth it.

												After seeing on how little Red Crucible Firestorm has progressed in a year I thought of making a review of this gameI've played Red crucible since 2012 at the main site and Kongragate, used to be good back then until the Firestorm struckRed Crucible Firestorm lacks both the quality and quantity an FPS usully hasWhat Red Crucibles Firestorm tries to do is to make itself unique as an FPS and tries to stand out,but instead fails most of it.uninspired game modes, classes and maps, outdated visual, long load time, poor voice acting, numerous of bugs, lags and crashes, low replay value,tedious and bland gameplay, poorly-designed spawn points and system as well as the lifeless community.  If you were to compile a list of the most overused elements of multiplayer FPS from the dawn of the genre to today  Red Crucible Firestorm would be a much crappier version of what you’re imagining (with pay to win mechanics to the fullest extend)You could either get premium weapons (which are better than the regular ones) by either grinding for months, or pay 20$ or more depending on weaponAs a free to play FPS, this game will continuously and desperatly try to take money away from you by large amounts. Rocketeer Games Studio will be desperate enough to the point where they nerfed every existing weapon to release better ones so you woud keep spending your money like a fool.Instead of making Red Crucible Firestorm a better game by fixing bugs and major issues, and releasing any new content at all, Rocketeer Games Studio is too busy releasing new weapons and vehicles weekly so players would spend 20$ for it or more to gamble for it since some of the weapons are only obtainable by gambling  real money.In short, there is no reason to ever play Red Crucible Firestorm at this state.Never waste time and money on this

												WARNING: This is a Free To Play (FTP) but Pay To Win (PTW) game.First thing I have mention, is the fact that this game is a PTW. If you are not willing to spend a good 50-80 bucks on this, I would just recomend on not playing it at all. I started playing RC:FS a few months ago, when the PTW was not so intense as it is right now. Back then, you didn't have to buy any vehicles, just the weapons. The gameplay is insanely fun, if you spend the right cash on it. The game itself though, is completely loaded with hackers/cheaters so that's kind of annoying.The graphics on this game are not bad, they have a little feeling to it, which makes it enjoyable. I guess I just have to say, don't play if you are not ready to spend some cash on it. Excuse me if it kinda makes no sense or if I made any grammar mistakes for English is not my native lenguage.

content:
Posted: January 23
												Okay, this is NOT bad game, as far as gameplay goes. It's similar to the Battlefield series, you can get in tanks, helicopters, and jeeps. Or you can just run around on foot. It's a very cool game when you first open it. Graphics aren't the best either.Now the bugs. The bugs in starting the game are terrible. Sometimes I'm stuck on the loading screen and can't get past it. Sometimes game crashes randomly while trying to start it. Sometimes I'm stuck on the main menu and all the buttons disappear except the exit button. Frustrating at first. But somehow if I leave the game alone for a day, or even just a few hours, and I come back, the game runs normally. Pretty weird. A lot of other people are having the same problems in the discusions. But like I said, overall gameplay is fun. It's even funner with friends.

								Shortly after getting this game and playing it for a while i found that red crucible firestorm doesnt have much changes from its previous games such as red crucible and red crucible 2 on kongregate which i found red crucible always to befun. but there are pros and cons to this game pros include the game is fun and easy to learn, most people and notice how i said most people are relativley friendly and good sport so you wont have trouble finding good competition and fun on this game (unlike cs go where everyone is a butthurt silver) the game does not take much to run on your computer of course though you do need a little more than a potato to run it decently. cons include you have limited resources (grenades, smokes, airstrikes ect ect) THERE ARE INGAME PURCHASES and yes all caps because this is a big deal because for example thee could be people that absolutley destroy you because they have better equipment and ive come across this quite a few times but you can still easily grind for money and experience and get these items i in my opinion its not exactly a pay to play game it is balanced and the payments are not neccesarry to be able to beat people. but overall i do recommend this game.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Here are my first impressions on the game (mind that first impressions of a game are very important because they need to keep the player playing, especially in a free to play title):The Graphics options are lackluster, but the game offers some standart-ish Unity settings.Mouse smoothing can't be disabled and hurts my feelings. A lot.Textures and models load into the game as if it was in a browser, a big no for me at least.The gameplay is slow and sluggish. There are weapons that are objectively better than others and the game goes as far as allowing weapon upgrading. (P2W)The sound design is pretty terrible.This game is no alternative to known shooters and if you want a free to play shooter, there are some decent ones out there, get one of them.

number of helpful: 66 of 127 people (52%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								Played far long enough to get the idea, while it's free to play i cant particularly recommend it in it's current state. Now keeping in mind im aware it's in Early Access, it still feels very bare-bones and unfinished, it's the bare minimum of what you'd call a functional game. I'd check on it after a month or two to see how much it's progressed, but as it stands, there's simply not enough content. Badly done animations, awful sound effects, slow and janky controls and an overall hollow and cheap feeling that cant really be accurately described unless you try for yourself. There's really nothing special that makes it stand out in an overcrowded FPS market. Even older Korean F2P games from several years ago play and look better than this.THE GOOD+ Maps are large/medium sized and feel alright+ Weapons appear to be decently balanced+ The ability to pilot aircraft and vehicles+ Seems to run well on older machinesTHE BAD- Muddy and bland graphics- Floaty and unrefined controls- No voice chat- Menus/Options are insultingly bare-bones- Sound Effects/Voices are hilariously bad- Poorly optimized, constant FPS spikesTHE UGLYIphone/browser "gamers" thinking this thing is actually quality entertainment.


YouTube™ Video: Picard's Epic Double Facepalm 

			Views: 1,654,811		

			For those moments when one facepalm doesn't quite cut it...		

BOTTOM LINEIt definitely needs a lot of work. Red Crucible is essentially a glorified browser game thrown together on steam to try to make a quick buck. It feels like it's trying to cheaply imitate the Battlefield series, but honestly, there are much better alternatives at the moment. (Planetside 2, Battlefield Play4Free, WarRock,) Or you know, you could actually go BUY an actual Battlefield game. Check on it again in a few months of this review and see if things get better.4/10 Not Recommended

												Theres some reasons why I uninstalled this game;1. SWEET CHRIST WHAT IS THAT MUTATION IN THE LOADOUT SCREEN?!2. Tiered guns, basically poor man's COD but with more expensive prices3. P2W, 1 guy buys the most op weapon in the game, thats gg for the whole entire match4. RPGs and explosives don't respond as is, if you direct hit a guy with an RPG, it won't kill him, instead, it'll just clip right through him.5. The amount of lag...6. Does EVERY item in this game have to be paid to use?!7. Uzi as a secondary? Srsly?8. The maps are literally 1 sided, theres no way to balance it, unless you folow reason no. 2.9. Too little ammo for any type of combat, since after you wasted 1 clip, you have to run all the way back to an ammo stash.10. Leveling up is completely slow and pointless.11. So health packs are basically useless, not only the hp needs to be paid (as always), it only heals the player up to 75% of hp, which is really fkin stupid.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												(RE-EDIT)Red Crucible Firestorm is NOT PAY TO WIN. Most of the people here who have reviewed don't even have ONE HOUR OF GAMEPLAY. Sure, there are OP looking customized weapons, but you can get competing guns in the unlock tier with the ingame currency, which in my opinion is very easy to get, especially with the fact that there are daily rewards that grant you a consumable, honor points, and once I got premium currency, so therefore if you keep grinding and getting daily rewards you could eventually get something good. Starting the game people will just judge it by the cheesy tutorial and perhaps encountering some bad players that have no idea what they are doing in the lower levels, or vice versa. Somewhat like Warframe where you have to grind and you get daily rewards (pretty much the only similarity), I like this game. You may be bad at the beginning, or maybe you're a killing smurf, I don't know. But atleast give this game an hour or two before you rant about the game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29, 2016
												This game is, well, kind of good. Let me explain. I will first list the positives and negatives of the game then go on to talk about my personal complications with my first through playthroughs of the game.Positives:+Good Gameplay, runs smoothly on old and new computers+Downloaded super fast.+Good community, nice people+Doesn't really force you to pay for anything+Nice selection of vehicles that are easy control and spawn quickly.Negatives (Hope you are ready):- Bad Graphics- Horrible Sound FX- Over used FPS cliche (the game is extremely alike to any Battlefield game)- Not a wide choice of weaponry when you first start out (which isn't that big of a problem because most fps' are like that)- There is only 4 maps in the entire game.- While all vehicles are easy to maneveur they are extremely too fast and un realistic.- You can't turn up the brightness?- *cough cough* bad graphics.Alright now I am going to go ahead and talk about my personal experiences, good and bad.When I first launched the game the first thing I noticed was the menu, it's easy to use and fast and efficient, but is a little bit bland, with no sound fx on anything you click, which isn't a big deal but it's nice to have some feedback when you click something. I then went to the settings to see if I needed to change anything with the graphics. When scrolling through the options I noticed there is no brightness setting what so ever. This wasn't a problem at the time but would later prove as one later on. I then proceeded to start up the game after dicking with the settings and joined a game quickly. Sweet, didn't have to wait a long time so that means there is a good amount of people playing. When I finally got in the game this is when the brightness level was a problem, I couldn't see a thing and the brightness on my laptop was all the way up. Thankfully I just started using my mini flatscreen as my daul monitor and turned up the brightness on  it instead, perfect the game is good now. I will edit this later when I have more to complaim about. But over all I recommend this game, it just has some minor flaws to it but hey, it's free.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has quite a bit of potential, I must say. Before reading more, please note that I am aware of this game being in early stages. Brushed up textures, sounds, improved gun handling and flight mechanics and this will be quite the treasure! One of the few things that could be added is radio chatter; I've noticed that your character calls out all objective being captured from their position (perhaps he had a hunch). Different vehicle types for each faction/team would be nice to see as well. For team game modes, it would be nicer to see people wearing similar camo rather than everyone looking as if they attended a free for all (for the aspect of immersion, I suppose). A field of view slider or at least a wider field would be better as well. Being able to go prone would be quite nice but then again you would have those skrubs doing drop shots. An attachment system would be pretty nice, even if they stuck with the current upgrade system for weapons. Have an initial base weapon - standard rifle with no attachments which could then be ugraded into a rifle with a sight or foregrip and so on and so forth. All that being said, you really should give this game a chance, it can be rather fun and it's free - you literally cannot complain! :D

content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								this game is great.now i've played a lot of battlefield(bad company 2, battlefield 3 and 4)  and a lot of COD(basically all of them)and i could say this game takes a bit from both of those titles. it has good gameplay, even your rotten potato can run it and while i've only played on 2 maps(i think they are only 2 maps in general. 1 for close combat and 1 for vehicles and long range combat) they both have a fair amount of content. this game is great, but not perfect, keep in mind that this IS a free to play game and you shouldn't expect the same qualities of a full priced games here. it has its cons, for example, only 2 maps (at the time of this review) and it does get repetitive after a few hours but still, it can be a good time-passer while you wait for other games to download.another good thing that i like about this game is the constent updates. since the day i downloaded it (2 weeks ago) my steam updated this game 3 times. so i'm guessing there will be more maps, vehicles and weapons to come in the future.and the ONE thing that i absolutely hate about this game is the price for weapons, for example: an "O.K" sniper rifle is 35k$(or honors) and each match gives you about 50-200(depending on how well you play) so it takes an enormous amount of time for you to get your first "good"(you could call it like that) gun.but all the pros and cons aside, i enjoy this game as a way to pass time, its fun, it can be tense from time to time and if you play with friends, it could make for a good free tactical shooter.

Early Access Review
								While I recommend this game, it is not without a grain of salt.Pros:-Will run on a toaster. Ignore minimum specs, they are way off/-F2P-MOAR BADASS RUSSIANSCons:-Aiming feels a bit all over the place. (even with sensitivity tuned to my skill)-Right click to ironsight, but you have to click again to stop. (this one annoys me)-No strafing/any movement other than forward when sprinting.-Weapons/vehicles don't feel satsfying to use. They all feel very rigid, and the SFX in no way helps them.Download this game if you are looking for a bit of fun, but don't want a game that requires much investment/CPU power/actual skill.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
												Pros:                                                                                                                        -Fun game that rewards daily playing                                                                    -Great gamemodes                                                                                               -No voice chat so my mom isn't getting ♥♥♥♥ed by 12 year old kids                    -Ridiculously op 3rd person peek and deployable turret                                     -Speed tanks                                                                                                          -Somewhat balanced helicopter combat                                                              -Clans                                                                                                                     -Spawn camping is prohibited-Free Cons:-Rewards aren't always the best-Limited selection of maps-Text only is hard when trying to strategize-Helicopter can be too op sometimes-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in-game friends system-People camping inside spawn protection-Pay to winAt the end of the day, Red Crucible: Firestorm is a great game with some bad elements. It built off the concepts introduced in Red Crucible 2 and made major improvements to balance, including adding limited ammo, vehicle spawners, and better weapon tiers. Maps were modified and improved, with a few failures (I'm looking at you, Favela!) and shortcomings. I recommend this game, but don't feel bad if you get rekt by the one guy with the purchased weapon.My suggestions to the team: make some servers block pay to win weapons.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								It's Just a nicer looking version of the standard version of Red Cruicible 2, that was available on their website and on Kongregrate. They've added a few extra features such as customisable weapons and additional consumables i.e. Claymores and Smoke Grenades. Whilst it is easier to just throw a couple bucks at this game to get some of the better, the level unlockable ones are good enough in most gunfights. The best way to think of this game is play it as a poor mans Battlefield where most things will cost you money or will take a long♥♥♥♥♥time to unlock.Is it worth downloading and playing? Yes. Is it worth spending money on? No, not unless you wish to grind countless hours like I did with the original.6/10 would be a fair verdict. Great time waster, but not something to spend countless hours in.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has a better hit detection than Battlefield 4 (tried CTE after a long break — nuh-huh, good luck killing anyone). Infantry gameplay-wise, it's much less frustrating. Here I could run around spamming voice commands (= no strafing!) and still do pretty good.There is certainly a room for improvement. Namely, graphics aren't particularly modern, sounds need more detail, aiming feels "slippery" and the menus are a bit confusing (combine store with loadout? "Leave" button only on a scoreboard screen?). However, considering this game is an Early Access, hopefully, it will become a nice F2P gem in YOUR library.

												For someone who wants to play battlefield but has no money, this game is a fun poor man's bf to play with friends. While most of the weapons and vehicles will cost you an arm and a leg in in-app purchases, I don't think it's pay to win. Only thing I would add would be the ability to go prone.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								In its current state i cant recomend this game due to a few bugs that ruin the game.Splash damage: I was in a APC when i was bombed, after a few seconds they laned 4 feet from me yet i took no damage even though i should have died or should have taken damage to the point 1 hit could kill me.Tanks/APC's: These are to buggy when driving upward or downward the camera shakes up and down making it hard to aim at aircraft and does get annoying when driving to a location. Hopefuly this is an easy fix and in the next update this gets fixed.Tank/APC spawning: There needs to be a timer when a vehical is spawned because if i spawned a APC after someone spawned another one we are both glitched in eachother and its random but one of us will end up half under the ground unable to move. From what i know the only way to fix that is to respawn the vehical.Driving: Im able to stop instantly making me able to stablize and fire almost as soon as i stop. When driving over some barriars there can be a glitch like the spawning one where half your vehical is under the ground unable to move. Sometimes it will blow up as soon as you exit and other times it wont but this is a huge issue thats bugging me since it happends a few times a game.Flying: So far aircraft have no use other then a reason to jump out and parachute down. In an APC im able to shoot someone down as soon as they leave and since helicopters have no offencive armaments they can easily be shot down if the pilot does not eject. I know more will be added but again air vehicals are not worth it yet it will either get you killed or you will have to bail out and again die from an APC.Stamina: You can infinatly run without having to stop. This is one thing i wish to see added as soon as posible since this does get annoying. Most of the issues are with vehicals but at this current state all i can say is i cannot recommend the game yet. Later on when a few more updates and patches come out it will be improved just its not there yet.

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have played this game since Red Crucible 2, to Red Crucible Firestorm Beta to now, and I rest my case. This game is a good start up, but needs some serious work to become something bigger.Pros:- A bunch of customization options- A good balance of graphics to appeal to a wide variety of computer setups- Vehicles that actually work- A good variety of maps and modes- A smooth, great feeling Cons:- Wonky gun mechanics- HORRIBLE map balance, with teams having a big advantage on some over the other- Sound design is horrible- Class balance is whack- Needs polishing on a few bugs on controls and hit boxes on player models- While character customization is awesome, the weapon customization is zero to nothingVerdict:A very early game (Take a look at the title, "Early Access" geniuses), I would say is a good start up, though the game is held back by balance issues and even, a lack of players. I would say, try it out, and if it floats your boat, stay tuned for upcoming updates that Rocketeer Studios will put out that will make your experience even better. If you don't like this game, make sure to give them constructive feedback at their forums. I don't hate anyone more who say "I hate this game. This game sucks." And that's it. Give them constructive feedback, so that they can consider ways to fix your concerns.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								*FIRST IMPRESSIONS**Training Mode (It's for noobs, I know this.)*So this pretty much seem like a generic shooter, but worse, It has terrible graphics and optimizations are not apparent. The sound effects are pretty much more boring than watching reality tv for 24 hours while strapped down to a chair. And announcers voice lines are so terrible it sounds like they were recorded via Skype and 2 people there were using desk mics next to their speakers.*First Multiplayer Match*Matchmaking is terrible, I clicked the play button and ended in up in the same lobby 10 times in a row, So I decide to open up the server browser and what do I find? 4 games........... So I guess other people know it's terrible too...... People die easy and I die easy, It looks like there is no real balance in this game so far. I exited the game and uninstalled because, I just couldn't put myself up to playing an entire match because it was so mind numbingly boring.*FINAL VERDICT*Graphics 6/20Sound 4/20Gameplay 4/20Optimizations 3/20Originality 0/2017/100Bloody awful, You would have more fun watching paint dry.

number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful6 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
At first the game looks good, but if you play longer you will see what I mean, if I say the game is♥♥♥♥♥♥GraphicsThe Graphics are more like 2005 than 2016, and there are oftengraphical bugs. On some maps there are spots with totally no light, were players are camping and sniping.In general it looks like some Unity Assetpack.WeaponsThe Weapons are okay in my opinion. One of the things I like in this game.But one Problem is, that the game is totally Pay2Win.Vehicles & General PerformanceThe Vehicles are totally buggy and the pay2win tanks are totally op.The Challenger2 Tank combined with vehicle regeneration is totally invincible!Sometimes when the game hates you and you go into a helicopter you get teleportet in the void, and you have to restart your game. But if you never restartet games, in Red Crucible you will learn it!For example sometimes you cant change your weapon anymore or cant click on some buttons, or you are even unable to shoot. In all these cases you have to restart.ModsThere are in general 2 Problems with mods.There are nearly no modsIf a Mod is in your match, you better leave, because they are abusive af!To the first Problem: I play this game since last year every few weeks, and there is a flyhacker I know since the beginning. He still didn't got banned. I already have him on skype xDHackers just won't get banned.To the second Problem: I have mods only sometimes in matches. But when you got a Mod in your match, you should leave immediately!Most mods are hacking, for example using commands to kill some players for fun, and they are changing your ingamename and/or they are removing items or money from your account (Ingameaccount, not Steamaccount)I just hate the mods in this game, I am happy, that I am not banned. I have many friends who already got 30-days bans for nothing...ConclusionI wouldn't recommend this game. One year ago it was fine. But the devs do nothing on this games, except putting in new pay2win weapons&vehicles.So, If you want to invest about 200$ in weapons etc. and invest it often, because a mod can ban you, this game is for you! (But you could just buy battlefield. Costs less, and is better)

number of helpful: 13 of 25 people (52%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												Round up:Graphics - 6-7/10 (Look below)Gameplay - 9.5/10Guns - 8/10Physics - 7/10Overall - 9/10 (Cos hackers) :(((((For more details look belowNote: I have spent about 5000-6500 hours on this game on browser and about £150/$250 on stuffMany people don't see the potential in this game. For a previously browser game (Red Crucible 2) it is exceptional. The gameplay on this game is one of the best i have known - far surpasses any from Call of Duty. In this game there is around 10 maps i think (not sure since new updates) and all of them are so diverse from each other - One minute you could be having a close quarters gun match but then the next you could be having a tank battle in the middle of the desert. There is one flaw to the maps and that is that they (for some reason) removed Favela, which any previous players would have known that this was the best map on this game - if not one of the best for any game. And thats saying something seeming as it is a browser based game (or was). However, the CEO of Rocketeer Games has said that they would be reintroducing it to the game. Hopefully then the game will be back in its former glory. The next thing - The guns. The diversity of guns in this game is mindblowing. These can feature from close quarters guns such as the Deagle (Which for some reason in this game is called the DEagle) to the M95 one shot sniper rifle. Gun paints are included with some weapons (which never used to be a feature) with decent designs. You can also get sights for some weapons which is epic. Only flaw to this is that they only seem to come with paid guns (or 60,000 - 100,000 honor points guns) and they cannot be bought separate or individual. So overall the guns are pretty good.Also the suits/skins are very expensive with some only being able to be bought with money (another flaw). The graphics: Decent enough for a browser based games. However they need top-range processors and graphics cards from my experience. I use a AMD Radeon 7500 series card and a Intel i5 processor (not very good to be fair) and i can only seem to run on lowest settings at 120fps whereas when i use medium graphics i can only run at 40fps (wtf????). So maybe this game is optimized more for Nvidea users. This is just my experience so no idea.Hackers: The thing that lets this game down so much is that there are so many hackers. Would be great if Rocketeer introduced a new vote kicking system. I would also like to see Moderators in servers (might be in new update: ive not spent much time on)EDIT: Vote kicking has been integrated into the game now and hacking is almost non-existent due to this

number of helpful: 14 of 28 people (50%) found this review helpful14 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Essentially what Red Crucible does is it takes the best elements from both the Call of Duty franchise and Battlefield franchise and combines them to have the best of both worlds without the negatives. If you're looking for the next step in online fps action, this is the game for you. Don't let the fact that it is free deter you from what is easily shaping up to be one of the best games of 2015. Don't pay attention to negative reviews that say things like  "this game is♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; or "♥♥♥♥ this trash pile", there was an argument between some of the devs which resulted in disgruntled employees writing poor reviews for this game. Where Red Crucible really steps up is through it's intense multiplayer matches, that, coupled with next gen graphics and realistic weapon/vehicle sounds creates a fantastic combat atmosphere. This game is truly immersive and it's FREE!! Now I know that free to play games can often garner a sense of poor quality and a "pay to win" feel where microtransactions reign supreme. But fear not because this game has ZERO microtransactions, none whatsoever. And that is good news for passionate fps gamers. You have nothing to lose by downloading this game and spending countless hours shooting your friends in unprecedented 1080p beauty. I only have 0.3 hours on record as I am writing this review from a second account. Cheers and enjoy the game.

Early Access Review
								Ive really gotten enjoyment out of this game so far. It has quite a bit of potential, but me and my friend came across a bug: Me and him had the same # title of Kiev maps, but got logged into the "same" match and it was 2 totally different servers. But, it doesnt stop me from playing and getting new things. I'd like to see a higher player count on the bigger maps, more maps, and leaning instead of having to go in-and-out of 3rd person to check your corners.Overall, i'd give it a 8.5/10 because of the lack of maps.I do recommend this game, its definitly helped with my PC FPS skills a lot, and improved my console skills extensivley, coming from a console-geek. Some of the weapons need to be nerfed, like the AK-74, is kind of OP in my opinion, and you need to buff the FAMAS so far. This has won my heart so far for Mac Free-To-Play games...-Hawkmoon

content:
Posted: July 11, 2016
												This game is good however there is one problem, when there is a hacker, glitcher etc you can votekick, the votekick itself isn't bad but the way it kicks is flawed, there will always be that one person who doesn't vote yes and the person continues hacking/glitching, there should also be a reporting system where you can report a player instead of just kicking, reporting makes it better as if there are various reports on a player you can decide that that person has been hacking/glitching and you can put an end to it. My views on the game however is that there are too many OP guns such as the wrecker, if you can tone down the settings you can avoid annoying campers who mow down people from spawn. Every day I go on the game play 5 mins and there is a hacker or glitcher or some dude with an OP gun that just makes me leave the game.I enjoy this game though, it's just a shame some people ruin it by doing these things.P.S PLEASE add cars/helicopters to Frankfurt and Red Dawn and shorten helicopter respawn times. Thanks!

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								To be honest, this game is great. It is very addicting, very simple, and very fun. There are 1 or 2 minor kinks, but overall, I have not seen many bugs. The game is paced well for the most part and matches are the perfect length. Guns feel nice, and work well. The community is ok, and I've only come across 2 hackers, and those were speedhacks. You unlock more weapons, maps, and character customization items with money earned in game, buying gold for real money, or just levelling up. This is a f2p game that runs well, and plays well. If you want to kill some time, I would defininetly recommend this game if you like shooters. I have way more than 2 hours total because this game was on Kongregate way before Steam.TL;DR: Good game, great weapons and vehicles, not too many bugs. 8/10

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
												I have been playing Red Crucible Firestrom for quite a whle and dominating servers daily but i have stopped ever since i came across a GROZA-M(a premium gun for whch you could buy in the store for around $20)I was in the second tier pool and seeing this guy have a gun whch is a tier above me and destroying servers eviscerates the fun in the game.And my gun, (a PKMG)could not even equalize to the overpoweredness of the gun.So as his body armor.This is already an element of a pay2win game.Secondly, the amount of bugs in the game.I was once in a lobby waiting for the 30 second countdown to expire when i somehow managed to glitch myself out of it.All the players were standing still and i was thus free.I managed to get to a usual place for me to spawncamp, and sure enough,players started running out and i got a multikill in seconds.Another element of a bad game.Even grenades are bugged,peole shootng through the walls and abusing the third person view to check behind walls.The hitmarkers are bad, showing me that i headshotted someone but did'nt get the kill.All in all,there's nothing wrong with playing this game.Its just that how glitchy and pay2win this game is offering you $20 dollars for a virtual gun.

number of helpful: 14 of 28 people (50%) found this review helpful14 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Essentially what Red Crucible does is it takes the best elements from both the Call of Duty franchise and Battlefield franchise and combines them to have the best of both worlds without the negatives. If you're looking for the next step in online fps action, this is the game for you. Don't let the fact that it is free deter you from what is easily shaping up to be one of the best games of 2015. Don't pay attention to negative reviews that say things like  "this game is♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; or "♥♥♥♥ this trash pile", there was an argument between some of the devs which resulted in disgruntled employees writing poor reviews for this game. Where Red Crucible really steps up is through it's intense multiplayer matches, that, coupled with next gen graphics and realistic weapon/vehicle sounds creates a fantastic combat atmosphere. This game is truly immersive and it's FREE!! Now I know that free to play games can often garner a sense of poor quality and a "pay to win" feel where microtransactions reign supreme. But fear not because this game has ZERO microtransactions, none whatsoever. And that is good news for passionate fps gamers. You have nothing to lose by downloading this game and spending countless hours shooting your friends in unprecedented 1080p beauty. I only have 0.3 hours on record as I am writing this review from a second account. Cheers and enjoy the game.

Early Access Review
								It feels like every other shooter, but that is not a bad thing. Red Crucible: Firestorm is a shooter that you instantly know how to play if you play FPSs with a keyboard and mouse. Although struggling behind in terms of gameplay features and gameplay elements, it feels nice in the hands (even though the default sensitivity might be really sluggish for some). I feel confident to see where this game goes. In the end, Firestorm has potential to be that free FPS killer we would all go to to play.

								Well, I went into this game with open arms and a child's heart. My friends told me to get this game, trusting the ones i once loved, I hit "Yes, I accept". Twenty seconds later I was brought into a menu that made no sense, so I clicked a start button, or some♥♥♥♥♥♥like that, and was immediatly brought into a match. I found the controls to be much like a COD or BF game, so nothing new, went searching around when a saw an army guy that didn't have a name over him, took a shot, and BAM headshot. I then realized that that was the best feeling in the game, and I didn't feel a thing. Yes I killed a guy, yes his children will get governament funded school (dependind on what country i'm fighting against, we all look like stock "Burly White Guys With Guns"). I now need to physicaly hurt my beloved friends due to this game.10/10 IGN

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								It has potential. Its also a little odd that people who played it for only a few minutes bash it. Early Access games are always in different stages of completion when released to us and I think a lot of people forget that. rather they think that being a Steam member means that they get exclusive access to a nearly finished game...because they were awesome enough to install Steam. I really enjoy watching Early Access games develop while others seem to become disenchanted with the process. Those folks should just stay away from Early Access. It only aggravates them.After playing for a little while (and Im not sure why Steam has my time so low) I can tell what they are trying to achieve. It feels like a cross between Battlefield, Insurgency, and older CoD. Since the player has the ability to set various mine types, toss various grenades, AND call in an air strike, it really give each player the ability to change the course of a battle. That is something that is missing in certain games like Insurgency or the other two aforementioned. Since a class system limits your ability to effect change during a battle, you do not always have an opportunity to be a "game-changer". If the devs stick with this, and polish the game to completion, this will become the central feature that will make this game different than others. Just try it out and you'll see what I mean. How many times were you playing BF, CoD, or even Insurgency and you see an opportunity to do something but cant due to class restriction? I know there are many times that I see a tactical strike or manuever that I cant do but someone else can...and they miss that window...and Im screaming at the monitor. In Red Crucible there are less missed opportunities. And that makes the basic structure of the gameplay and character foundation refreshing.BTW, its free. Just try it out. It downloads in seconds...literally.

Very repetitive and also sometimes, server failures.

								Hey, Ozzny here, i'm an old player, almost 2 years playing the old update "RC2" and i am in raking.So, in my opinion RCF is a great game, although it has some bugs but its being worked on.I see people saying "this game sucks" , "no recommend". content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												Nope. It's just not a good first person shooter. You are better off with CS:GO. The movement keys are one of the standard FPS games model. Basically, the WASD movements, G for grenade, Shift for Sprint and C for crouch. The game felt extremely unsmooth compared to games like Call of Duty, things like aiming, throwing the grenade and shooting behind a wall felt unpolished. Pay to win and the 750 coins for $10 just blew it for me.PROS1. Interesting mapsThe map I played was Kiev, where you fight onboard an aircraft carrier. Although, you have that in the Battlefield series.2. Map interactionsYou get to use the elevator to move between the top deck and middle decks of the aircraft carrier which I found fun.3. Friendly Fire SystemIf you aim over your ally, an X will appear to prevent you from shooting them. A bit better than friendly fire off/on.CONS1. Pay To WinIt's kind of obvious. Just look at their cash shop for more information. Best deal is 750 coins for $10 and that's a one-time offer. 750 coins won't even buy you a good gun, they cost a 1000 coins.2. So Much GrindingYou actually have to unlock guns, maps and tanks, not just achievements. I had to pay 25 coins for a map called Frankfurt. It boggles the mind why you even need to grind for maps. I think the developer really believes the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t about extending player grinding. I got very turned off by this.3. Unpolished Partsa. Aiming Down the SightToo slow. It feels fake.b. Throwing the GrenadeMy grenade actually bounced up a slope.c. ReloadingToo slow.d. Shooting from behind a wallI think my gun jams if more than 50% of your body is behind the wall, so you can still see the enemy but you can't shoot.

RGS are working hard to make the game better and since the release, they already improved the game a lot by listening to players feedback and that's good for the community.Another thing, the game hasn't only 1 map, don't worry it has 6 arenas and 1 coming soon, you guys can't unlock them but that must be some bug and i'm sure it will be fixed as soon as its possible.Anyway this game is a Free2Play and not Pay2Win so it worth to download it and give it a try! Cheers, Ozzny.

content:
Posted: March 18
												I would Highly recomend this game if you are willing to spend money. What I am really saying is it is a pay to win game. I obviously being the fool I am spent $10 on this game and I am enjoyiing it. But if you look at it in a fair light if a game is free then there must be some way for the creaters to make money. That is why I do not understand people who are ranting and raving about a game being a pay to win. I said that but I wasn't complaining about it. Now there is a pretty bad problem that needs to be fixed and it is concerning what I purchased. I bought an M4A1. A basic gun I was so exited about whipping it out in a match and destroying everyone in sight. But unfortunatly when I took it out and looked through the sight I couldn't see through. There is some weird glitch blocking my view when I aim. This has never happened with any other gun. I would be satisfied with a replacement or a refund so I can get a different gun. Now besides that everything else is ok. Some maps are weird and spawn camping gets pretty bad at some points in a game. I really hope they fix my request and for a final overall rating I will give it a 7.5/104/1/17Well after I wrote this review I played the game and my gun was fixed. Now it is up and running like it should be thank you for reading my review!!
