number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm going to rate this game up because you get good entertainment for being a free game. It is somewhat reminiscent of the Battlefield games, but with fewer players, so basically like the console version. It is early access and shows potential for what it already has.The vehicles are well designed and seem to be balanced. The guns seem fine and shouldn't need tweaking. What the game really needs to shine is a larger player-base and larger servers.Honestly, the fact that a game of this substance is free is pretty neat. The game is under a gigabyte in size but still has a lot of assets in it.Try the game out if your interested. It's around 795 MB, which shouldn't take long to download. The gameplay can be slow at times, but the maps are fun to roam around and you'll find enemies eventually.7/10 for its current early access state

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
TL;DR AT BOTTOM OF REVIEWAlthough I don't care much about the game's aesthetic value (or lack thereof) and poor graphics, or the fact that it's incredibly pay-to-win with yet another poorly implemented progression system, what really annoys me is that its mechanics within matches (relating to combat, movement etc) are completely broken, unbalanced, illogical and in various ways have ripped off games that have been more successful without sticking with a recurring theme throughout (If you'd like to know what I mean, search for gameplay of any of the Red Crucible games (since they're all the same). See if it interests you, keeping in mind a comparison of the game in question and another that isn't free to play - For example, Insurgency).As a result, the community consists almost entirely of people who barely know that the mouse buttons are used to shoot and aim down sights or through a scope and that the W, A, S and D keys are used to move the in-game character around a given map as anyone else has probably stopped playing the game by now.I've found that many Red Crucible players are quite toxic as well, and I've had a couple of 'hackusations' in my five hours playing this game, which does well to illustrate my aforementioned implication regarding the low median skill level of players.The game's maps are poorly designed and the majority are hidden behind in-game purchases; this, in my opinion, is a stupid decision from the developers as it segregates the game's community - Even more so since it's hard to find the page from which additional maps can be purchased - Many players will play nothing but the few maps offered to them from the very beginning.---------------------------------------------------Clearly, I wouldn't recommend this game. Here are some alternative games that I'd recommend playing instead if you're looking for a first-person shooter that doesn't cost money -Unreal Tournament 4 - An arena shooter that's in development and completely free as opposed to being free-to-play. The developers of the game are happy to take suggestions from the community, and everyone I've come across in said community whilst playing the game is extremely helpful and positive.Dirty Bomb - Despite having idiotic developers who don't listen to the game's community at all, the premise of its shooting, movement and map layouts is sound and it's one of the most satisfying shooters to play that isn't an arena game.Contract Wars - I personally dislike this one for similar reasons to why I dislike Red Crucible, but it's basically a step up in every possible way and far more focused on infantry combat as opposed to vehicular fighting. It's also browser-based, and its progression system is far better designed.Urban Terror - An open-source game with an HD version currently in the making. Its slogan is 'Fun over Realism' and this is reflected in gameplay.Alternatively, a game like Battlefield 4, which this tries quite hard to mimic, can be purchased from♥♥♥♥♥for less than ten dollars. I picked up the deluxe edition for twenty pounds during an O r i g i n sale, and its predecessors can be bought for even less. I've since seen similar sales offering the same discount multiple times, so keep looking on Origin if you're interested (I acknowledge that O r i g i n is evil, but it's still better than the Red Crucible series). Insurgency is also on sale often on Steam and various other websites, with its current price on♥♥♥♥♥being just over three pounds. It's a far better game from a technical standpoint, and New World Interactive have proved multiple times that they respect their community.---------------------------------------------------TL;DRWatch a bit of these two videos. If you think the first game looks better, don't bother with Red Crucible and try something I mentioned above.If you think the second game looks better, give it a go. Seriously, though, you're missing out on some really good games and if your budget really is zero you should also try the games I suggested above.---------------------------------------------------An example of the high skill ceiling in other games like Unreal Tournament.Red Crucible: Firestorm gameplay by a well-known (Relatively speaking) Red Crucible Youtuber.If your budget is greater than a few pounds, however, close this page, buy Insurgency, Battlefield, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive or any equivalent paid shooter, and make the most of your newly acquired game(s).Edited to prevent Steam's censorship of the word 'O r i g i n'Edited once again: From looking at other negative reviews for Red Crucible: Firestorm, it seems that someone is going through all of them and blindly rating them as being unhelpful. This is yet another example of the toxicity and stupidity of the community.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								I gave this game a try and it seems okay. It's Early Access right now so hopefully some of the issues will get figured out before final release.The gameplay is kind of fun but there are some definite problems that make it a bit annoying at times. One thing I thought was annoying was how the run key isn't like a regular run key. When you hold run, you are forced to run forward. You can turn your mouse from side to side when running, but, you cannot strafe whatsoever. Also when running you can not pull up your gun at all. You have to stop to shoot, but even when stopping to shoot there is a split second where you still can't aim. This can be annoying when fighingI also had issues with shooting over crates. Maybe it was just me, but every time I would be behind a crate and my crosshairs above, and I have someone in my sights I can't seem to ever hit them, like maybe the bullet isn't making it over the box, I am not sure.There are a ton of items & weapons in the game. When using items, you have to buy more because they each only seem to have one use. I loved using the airstrikes, that was fun stuff. Weapons seem to unlock as you level, or may be purchased. When they unlock however, they still need to be purchased (Although I don't know if they are cheaper this way..? maybe??)The maps are a strange situation once again. You start on Kiev and can only access that map until you level up and unlock other maps. These other unlocked maps must also be purchased either in game money or real money. It's of a strange setup because I would think that it could split the playerbase somewhat. Maybe I'm wrong.When you level up in game, you earn gold and in game money (honor I think). When you complete a map I think you earn honor, but no gold. I made 2 levels when I was on, and got 15 gold each one. That's not really enough to get anything decent though.Here's my very first playthrough video if you want to check it out.


YouTube™ Video: Lets Try Games - RED CRUCIBLE: FIRESTORM - Air Striking & Bullet Shooting 

			Views: 521		

			I was looking around on Steam last night and saw Red Crucible: Firestorm just came out. It's Free to Play and in Early Access. It's a FPS type of game. Sounds okay to me, time to check it out.		

I would recommend this game because I did have fun playing. It's a bit clunky and the animations are a little basic, but it's still in Early Access and it is Free to Play so there is no loss if you don't like it. Give it a shot, why not :)

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												First off, I've got more then 2K Hours invested into the game, but I play on the standalone and not this version, so trust me because I know what I'm talking about Mister Level 30 talking to you youngsters here.Now for those who's wondering if it's a Pay2Win, I'll be straight with you- no, it isn't, you can work towards getting a Premium Gun unlike other games, every 7 days you get a chance to win up to 100 coins, everyday you log in you get a reward a consumable, XPs or Honor Points. So if you're super lucky, you can earn up to 1,000 coins in about 10 weeks, or save up the 15 coins you earn each time you level up.Why does a single premium cost about 20 bucks? because they don't want the game infested with premium users, for those who want a small advantage of not showing up on the radar and more ammo capacity you'd whip out your wallet and give them about 20 bucks, but the weapon from the Class Section is just as good, just about 10 bullet less and you show up on the radar, because I'll be honest with you guys, every weapon has a tracer, so it's already pretty balanced out, it's only a big advantage in a Search and Destroy match where you arm the bomb or defuse it, and people rarely play that match.Now if you're new and you're wondering where these 600 Honor Points weapon and armor are follow these steps carefully.1. in the menu area, click on Character.2. click on the UNLOCK button at the top, next to Inventory and Store.3. and there you have it, this is where you'd find your Weapons of all Classes: Assault, Support, Sniper, Demolition- they even have your Secondary and Melee as an option.4. this also where you unlock maps a.k.a "Arena"5. Appearence is the Armor, if you're wondering why you're dying so fast, it's because you need armor, me personally, don't get the helmet, get the armor, because every weapon is a one shot to the head, although the Developers have told me that Helmets are suppose to add to how much armor you have, but they're pretty useless in my opinion, so don't waste Honor Points (HP) on them.Click on Browse to open the servers and matches, at the top you can see 2 option Create and Browse, the Play button is an auto set up match.Now this is one of the tricky parts of the game, when you reach lvl 20 you're going to have to face players 2 tiers above you, this is NORMAL, every high ranked players have all been through this, if you're wondering why they do this I'll give you a few ideas why-1. Lack of Players.2. Most players rarely play Vehicle matches, they want to encourage gameplay in vehicle maps, which is why once you've hit lvl 20- I'll give you 2 options at this point, try to use demolition as a weapon, it's really hard to do but it's a ONE SHOT KILL, which is why the blast radius is very small, you have to have direct impact- or you play the vehicle maps, unlike infantry maps vehicle maps will stay the same, the tank deals the same damage, the Choppers do too, just about everything does.Things that are considered inappropriate and can result in short and PERMANENT bans are posing as Moderators, Cursing in the public chat, and HACKING, if you find hacks on this game report to the developers immediately, at http://community.rocketeergames.com/categories/bug-reports If you find a hacker click on their profile copy their Gamer ID, (optional) record them or take screenshots, preferably recordings, report it the link above as well, this works for people who you see hacking or for people who are cursing or threatening you or making you feel uncomfortable, take a screenshot, the Developers and the community don't take kindly to them so rest assured they'll be dealt with- they have 2 warning one might be a 24 hour ban and a warning the second is Permanent.In a hacker's situation it's a permanent ban no warning no nothing, it doesn't matter if they have payed money or not, hackers are hackers in the community and the Developer's eyes, we have morals, there are a lot of people who record hackers and are very regarded on the forums, bounty hunters in a way.The game has evolve a lot in a year, there have been weapons, maps, and vehicles releases, we are now implementing a Achievement and Missions into the game, where you can earn up to 5K Honor points and 50 coins from doing them, though easy it takes a lot of time investments.Now if you're here and you're complaining about Graphics, yeah it isn't the greatest, but it's decent for a Free Game, if you want better you can spend your money elsewhere for it, it's a lot more then any other FPS facebook games you see out there, in the mass of CSGO wannabes this is a an okay game a lot like Battlefield.The recoil has a pattern so it's easy to control, which is what makes it a fun and easy game, one that is simple and easy to pick up on, if you do good in any FPS games give it a try, if you don't like it you don't like it, everyone has their preferences, and that's respectable, most players quit because the game gets dule for them- which is why I recommend making friends on the forums not ingame, because you lose that connection since you aren't close, we are a family on the forum, we look out for one another- no one is bigger or better.If you ever encounter any bugs, glitches, or issues with the game goto http://community.rocketeergames.com/categories/red-crucible-firestorm-beta-bugsBut if you ever need me, when no Moderators or Developers or responding I'll be glad to help, message me on the forums athttp://community.rocketeergames.com/profile/Ravenor Via Youtube (I prefer it if you messaged me on the forums, but if there are any technificulties you're welcome to use whichever media you prefer)https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMuBl0zaRohQdNNr2hLAznQI hope I have helped you, I've been going over a couple of these reviews and they aren't very descriptive or helpful, the way I see it- when giving criticism be sure to put things that can be improved on, otherwise they are just Spams, give real Opinions, not just 1 or 2 sentences based on how it was for you, that's all Folks if you stayed this long props, with that said, Peace ✌

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								My RCF Review overallA slight introductionAlright, Elite Rift here, and some of you may know me from older times, like RC2 where I was named Elite Hunter 39, and RC1 where I was named Excalibur 38.Now I have been playing Red Crucible for 5 years now.As a long-time player, I would like to say that Red Crucible has gone from a simple multiplayer tank-fighting game, to an all-out infantry and tank hybrid war in RC2.Now I understand RC2 had lesser graphics.I understand how RC2 allowed you to carry multiple weapons AND switch the weapons in the battlefield, but those weapon-switching days are gone.Seriously, I found it fun too, but look at other games like COD or Battlefield. They don't allow loadout changing in the battlefield. And thus it was removed.The RGS has gone for a more realistic development to the game, and are currently working on releasing a new map called "The Favela".RGS has improved the graphics from RC1, and quite frankly, they're still starting out, atleast two months fresh from the update, optimization can still be possible.The ConsAs for the cons in the game, there are some, and I will list down four of them.1. Improve the sounds for almost all the weapons. Sure the new sounds compared to RC1 show a vast improvement, but if you're going for realism, you have to be able to FEEL the power of a 7.62 mm caliber-rifle firing out.2. Some rifles in RCF are designed in such a way that the IRL stats compared to the RCF design doesn't fit. The SCAR for example. Designed as a SCAR-L ( 5.56mm ), however it's stats indicate that it's a 7.62mm gun. It also carries the normal 30 round 5.56mm magazine, and it's easily OP.3. Optimization. I understand you guys are working hard to release Favela and other gun updates, but I would like to suggest that you work on Optimization for even a bit more before moving on.4. OP weapons. I'd like to give an example but I think you know what I'm talking about.5. Katana length makes it looks like a Fang already.Overall?RCF is a major improvement to the game.The graphics, how the guns have been "balanced".They have come a long way from RC1, and I'd like to say that they've certainly improved.I would like to say however, those cons above are suggestions for improvement.RCF has great gameplay indeed. But it certainly holds room for improvement. A lot more, in fact.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have literally played this game for 50 minutes and I can all ready tell you it sucks.The gameplay is horrible. Most of the players are terrible at the game, making it too easy to be fun. I got 23 kills and 5 deaths my first match, so you can see where i'm coming from.The controls are fairly normal for an FPS game.The audio is not actually that bad. It's good enough to make you feel like you are in a paintball game but thats about it. All of the guns sound like pea shooters, and the environmental sounds are trash.The visuals are decent.The game is pay to win, NOT free to play. I matched with one individual with a RPK machine gun and he pretty much dominated the battlefield because the gun literally kills in one shot.All in all, its not worth your time to play this game.So here are some other games worth your time:- Counter Strike Global Offensive- Battlefield 2- Team Fortress 2- Star Wars BattlefrontAnd pretty much any FPS you can think of BESIDES the previous Red Crucible games.This game gets a 2/10 I did not find it enjoyable.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								I tried the game for about an hour, the game was very laggy and the FPS was very uncomfortable. Gameplay elements like vehicles are not that developed and it's pay2win (i dare you to deny that, the last assault rifle does way more damage than the m16 according to the stat bar)In other games like battlefield, you can have a high damage gun but then it would have low accuracy or high recoil, however this is not the case in RC:FS. They are all buffed guns with direct upgrade stats-Very bad performance-Never adjust FOV-pay to win -tank acting weird when moving on a non-flat surface (i understand the game is on development)-Lots of grinding -only 3 mags for the m16? Wtf?-Lots of purchasable gadgets like airstrike, grenades, medkits and you have to pay for them for quite a price. -no full map and not so good UI (idk if you can put a full map up but i haven't discover it yet)-No PING display? What?Why would you need to have i7, GTX660 and 8 gb ram to play that game (its recommended requirements)

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Regardless of the many annoying aspects of this game engine and things such as the inability to shoot through fences.. sniper scope says you are clear yet your round hits objects you are takeing cover behind thusly makeing true cover nonexistant... and others im not going to take the time to list the game idea is fun and simple....The developers say they are hard at work to fix many issues and make promises of new and better things to come.And one can make the argument that "dude its in beta"...and you would be correct.It is in beta and i am sure the devs will fix many of the issues this game faces.I am not here to bash this game or its developers.I am simply giving out the FACTS in an effort to help members of the steam community decide if this game is for them........Red Crucible is indeed 100% pay to win.It is not impossible to get the superior weapons and armor but it will take alot of luck and some serious grinding  and you will become a punching bag for those who spent the cash to have the advantage.The only way (OTHER THAN CASH) to obtain a weapon with anything other than iron sights is thru the formentioned process.Normally this wouldent be an issue but because of the engine this game is built on those with red dots and reflex sights have a decided advantage.Those who purchase the armor packs will charge at you while you lay into them and finish you off with melee.No i am not kidding...You obtain 15 in game gold every time you lvl up.The lvl cap is 35.Just one superior weapon can cost 600-1000 gold or 600,000-1,000,000 honor points.You folks can do the math.......... Is there anything wrong with pay to win games?Of couse not.I prefer free to play  were cash shop items are purely cosmetic and i have spent quite a lot of cash on such games over the years but to each thier own.Is Red Crucible a game i would spent cash on if so inclined?...no...Its just not that good....regardless of all the fixs in the world the game engine is what it is and the developers have made it perfectly clear without saying a word---->"you want to compete?pay up"....

Posted: May 8, 2016
Product received for free
												 I love this game, but some of it's features make it way worse.It is an awesome free shooter game that is easy to get into and most of the time is fun to play.The problem is that it's missions and maps are terrilble.  All of the maps except autobahn and favela are terrible.  They are way to big for the amount of players that they allow.  The missions can be fun, but ussually take veery long to complete and   often do not save your progress on them when a match ends.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												I love it... While it is a pay to win type of game you can still unlock items as you progress through the levels. The graphics are ok but a little dated. It kind of reminds me of Battlefield 2 in the graphics department. It runs smooth with no issues at all and I play it on a linux computer with AMD parts as we all know AMD drivers are terrible on Linux systems. I also have to say that I read a lot of negative reviews about this game, Glitches, full of hackers, hit box is off, etc... blah, blah, blah... I will say I have seen none of the issues others have had, if they in fact have had those issues. What I hate the most is people whining about all of these things when it is a free to play game. you gave it a try and didnt like it, move on and try something else. All in all you have to give this game a try, its free so you have nothing to lose. Unless you are one of those whiners that just have to complain about everything...

Early Access Review
								If you love old school pc shooters this is the one for you!. It has a lot of nostalgic feel to it, you can't change any of the keybinds but they're pretty easy to pick up. It has a lot of interesting weapons and a wide variety of game modes. If you want to have fun in an old school tactical shooter I would highly recommend you give this a try.Think Insurgency if you feel like testing your skill and tactics on a neat and modern looking map.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								6/4/2015Hello all, I doubt you know me, and do not caare for it, however, I am a excessive FPS player, and have verious things to say, explain, and suggest for RC:F in it's current standalone Alpha phase.Current Things I Think Are Missing:1) Toggle ADS/Hold ADS optionsNow, most people know, that in any fast paced bullet hell shooter, like RC:F, toggle ADS can be a absolute pain in the♥♥♥♥♥in close quarters. I agree! And to further this, the toggle ADS in this game, has gottan my♥♥♥♥♥killed more times than I ever care to count. As such, I think that a toggle/hold preference would be a very nice feature to the game in the overall long term of it, as this will make combat far more fluid, and weapons(such as LMGs and Sniper Rifles) far more usable.2) Health RestorationNow, most shooters, have a way to restore health, however, RC:F does not. "But, yes it does!": you're probabaly rambling. No, no it doesn't. Wasting currency that is already a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥grind to earn for medkits, is in my oppion, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T. Staying alive is a vital part of a shooter, and having a class that can deploy health, would vastly improove the game over all in things like TDM(exclude it in survival, or it'll never end), and conquest.3) Honour DropratesTheir ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Flat out. Maybe 30-60 for a match if you're top player for TDM and conquest, and MAYBE if you're lucky, 15-70 for winning a survival match. And to put this into perspective, the least a gun in the store costs, is 32,000. TO average the rate you'd need, you would have to play around nearly 10,000 matches to get what you need. I understand that it's probably like this because this was a facebook game taht's transitioning into a stand alone, but it's not okay to try and force the playbase to buy currency for anything of use. That kills a game fast, and it'll end up like certain other games(*cough* Warface, AVA, ect. *cough*). So I suggest to increase this substantialy. To around 150 for being top three on your team if you win, and 75 for top three for a lose. And in suvival perhaps 175 for winning, and reduce that by 25 for each place behind first you are(this being because Survival is far harder to win at).4) No Anti-Hack CurrentlyAs far as I've seen there's no anti hack, and people can use hall-hacks, and aimbot to their delight, and not even have to hide it(I've seen alot of it in this games first week already on Steam) and when a hack starts playing pepole start leaving fast. I suggest you guys look into Valve Anti Cheat quickly, and a way to activaly weed out hacks who are hiding on your game.5) The Giant Graphic for KillsThat thing gets in the way alot for me. I often am fighting on the ground, kill a guy, and am killed from above, because the graphic blocks a pretty large portion og the upper screen.If these things are implamented as a whole, I will be thrilled. but if things like 1,2,3,4 are implented at all, I'll be happy anyway, because it'll vastly improve overall enjoyablity of the game.My current thoughts of the game, is that it's very fun, and very fast. Could use some optimizations, as FPS difference between Ultra and Lowest is about 4 frames on a number of machines me and friends have tested, which goes to say it's poorly optimized in many ways, nonetheless even on a toaster, you will easily get 19-34 FPS after the game finishes it's background downloading, which I'd like to say I'm not a fan of, the game should update before launching, and through steam so your ping doesn't spike, and your fps doesn't♥♥♥♥♥♥itself.Anyway, this conludes my rantish thoughts of this game! Hope you enjoyed reading, this has been BlueDarterz! GLHF and kick some♥♥♥♥♥!!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great game! Here is quick tip for playing this game, remember to set your resoulution to max and all graphics settings on high, then it becomes much better! TIPS for better gameplay:-Purchase more maps with the ribbons for more gameplay options.-Try the snipers.-Set the resoulution to the max setting. PROS:-Poor Man's Battlefield-Easy on computer-The Snipers are OP.-Good Maps.-Golf CartsCONS:-Graphics need some improvement.-Arms to close to the screen.-Fences or other obsticales cant break.But overall it is a good game, I would recommend it if you cant buy Battlefield.

Early Access Review
								This game is infinitely better than Red Crucible 2.It's not p2w at all. The guns you can buy are only slightly better than base guns.Although the graphics are 2007-ish, some of the in-game artwork is pretty good.With minimum you can run the game 30-60 fps, I get maybe 30-40.Since it's early in development I recommend getting it and ranking up before everyone else gets it.My only main con is that the LMG's have been seriously downgraded, they're basically completely useless.This game needs a lot of work but it has a really good base to it, I see it being really good in the future.Also here is a story.>Be me>Day 1 of game, liking it so far>Just got brand new ak-74 from rank up>It only has 20 rounds in a mag, that's weird>Join TDM on kiev (favorite map=only map)>Absolutely destroying enemy>Go on 30 killstreak>Finally get knifed from 10 feet away (not abnormal)>Game then says, "Match Lost">WTF.jpeg>Look at scoreboard>Me 30 and 1>Everyone else on my team   0 and 15   0 and 5   0 and 7   0 and 12   0 and 10>well10/10 would lose because of crappy team again

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								Note: I've played this game since 2011, when it was still a browser game called Red Crucible 2 and probably have more like 50 hours of game time.Essentially, Red Crucible: Firestorm is still a browser game, just Red Crucible 2 with a fancy (and annoyingly convoluted) new UI slapped on. It's just another generic first person shooter with no personality."Don't be too hard on it. It's free-to-play!" -a reasonable point.However, to call this game free-to-play would be a stretch at best."Features of the "free-to-play" model:1. Consumables-LOTS of consumables. They sell experience and damage boosts that last 10 MINUTES. That's right, folks. Just pay about 25 cents worth of premium currency or some in game currency and you can get a little extra experience for a single round. You want to have extra experience for an hour? That will cost you about $1.50. Same thing goes for grenades, airstrikes, and medpacks. You have to buy all of those with currency or premium currency 1 at a time, which may seem cheap, but it adds up.2. Weapon upgrades. Most FPS games have a variety of different weapons that suit different roles but have tradeoffs i.e. higher damage but higher recoil, higher accuracy but lower rate of fire. Not in Red Crucible: Firestorm.In Red Crucible Firestorm, you PAY a lot of in game currency or real money to UPGRADE your weapons. That's right: the damage goes up with NO DOWNSIDES. You do unlock new weapons as you level up, BUT they are essentialy carbon copies of each other with higher damage.3. Armor upgrades-To go along with the weapon upgrades, you can buy and upgrade your armor with a lot of in game currency or real money. This offsets the advantage from upgrading your weapons.4. Premium weapons. You can buy premium weapons for 300-1000 coins or 30,000-100,000 "honor points," in game currency. This translates to prices of $10-$15 for a single weapon!!! And you can only buy coins in weird increments of 250, 750, 875, etc., forcing you to pay for more than you need. And buying with honor points? Forget it. It would take thousands of hours to get that many honor points from playing the games.IN CONCLUSION: In addition to tons of crappy consumables, you have to constantly upgrade your weapons and armor as you level up. These armor and weapon upgrades cancel each other out, leaving you with a net gain of 0, but if you don't upgrade or get better ones, you'll get left in the dust. The top tier automatic weapons can one-shot kill you many times over if you don't pay a ton to upgrade your armor. Also premium weapons are really expensive.Other cons:1. Graphics-They're what you'd expect from an internet flash game: bad by today's standards, maybe decent back in 2007.2. User Interface-It's terrible. Tons of nested menus and drop down bars. It's bad.3. Matchmaking-You often get placed in matches with people many levels above you. This means that they can one shot you with an upgraded version of the same gun you're using. You don't stand a chance.TL;DR: 3/10 Play it for the laughs. NEVER spend money.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								I can safely say that this is a mix of cod an battlefield. The Battlefield part:This game almost seems like a battlefield game at first glance(minus the amazing graphics) and i mean that in a good way. The reason that i think it feels like battlefield is because of the atmosphere it creates. You really do feel like you are in a real battle. And trust me, there are some really intense moments in this game. And, even though i played this game for a mere hour i can safely say that this is one of the best indie shooters that i ever played.  As of now there are barely any maps that are actually being played other than the kiev carrier map and i cant remember the other maps name.The Cod part:Bad graphicsWay to much hpVehicles are way to easy to drive. like the killstreaks in cod.notice that some of the screenshots are taken at 20 fps. Not kidding, if you look closely in the top right corner you'll see it.20 fps/10

								"Ultra" quality settings are definatly nowhere near "Fancy" setting on minecraft from what I saw from the inventory screen. Then when I went back to 5760 x 1080, the game had the same problem but crashed when I clicked on anything. This continued to happen on all resolutions and on all texture qualities. So overall this game is a huge disappointment and hopefully this will change in the updates to come. But of course this is MY reveiw from MY computer sso you may not have the same issues as me so I the game works for you, congrats and I hope you have fun playing it but I just couldn't get the game to work so I left this reveiw.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												The Platinum Edition to those unaware is really the PMC Gold Bundle. The three special weapons are the Scar, DEagle and Tomahawk. Plus you get the cosmetics like clothes, beards etc. The price to get this bundle is cheaper than it is than the actual gold price on the store page of RCF. I wouldn't recommend this bundle at all. Sure it's a good gun (scar) but there are gold bundles that cost like 20 dollars and are just as good. A good example would be the navy seal G. The game itself. Very Buggy especially the map Kiev-Low FPS and high Ping.  I can run bigger maps like A7 autobahn and Red Dawn with ease. The reload animations is poor. For Support weapons and Demolition it's disgusting. The Devs should focus on fixing these bugs rather than focus on adding new pricey ONLY GOLD VERSION guns. Overall i spent over 20 dollars on this game. I have a gold gun and ill tell you It's absolutely not worth it. What really annoys me is the sell price. Let's look at this in further detail below:-Normal guns cost 600 honor points. Sell price is a measly 60 honor-Bronze guns cost 30,000 honor points- Devs raised it to 35,000- Sell price is 3500-Silver guns cost 60,000 honor points. Sell price is 6000-Gold guns cost 100,000 honor points. Sell price is 10,000Let me also remind you that for an average player- 5/7 kills will equate to around 25 honor points. Plus the extra 25 points IF your team wins the match. So 50 in total. It's gonna take a helluva long time to save up 100,000 honor points...It seems that we get 10% of our money back which is completely stupid. It should be 50% for God's Sake.What's really sad is that the game has potential, except the Devs are not using this potential. Overall a disappointment for me.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Here are a few pros and cons on this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ I played it on Facebook a while so don't let my hours fool you+Satisfying to kill enemies+Big maps+Decently active community+Can be learned and played easily easily+No signup with your email ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t+Fairly simple mechanics for more casual FPS gamersAnd some cons-Graphics are about 12 years outdated-Even though the maps are big, which was a pro, they still ♥♥♥♥ing suck. You only use about 1/12 of it for actual fighting-Active community, but they still don't do jack♥♥♥♥♥♥ They don't work on the objective, they don't even let you go in the same vehicle as them.-Achieving new guns is almost impossible, it will take a week just for you to get the worst gun in the game. And the worst gun really ♥♥♥♥ing sucks. The only way to get out of your standard is to pay money.-Homescreen and stats look so unprofessional and bad. The fonts look like MS Paint and was incorporated into a game. Like the start screen of a game you made in a day when you were 15-Don't let the screenshots on this♥♥♥♥♥♥fool you with good looking graphics. They are the worst.-The replayability is just terrible. You'll play like 5 rounds (which should I note take about 10 minutes) then never play the game again.I rate this game a 3/10. Killing enemies is satisfying, active community, and easy to pick up on. But also extremely aggravating and something you'll never play ever again.

I played the game for less than 30 minutes and I ran into a god mode hacker. I do not hate this game, but I do not recommend it. It is free, though. I do not want to sway anyone, but definitely try the game out if you do not believe me. There are some alright aspects, though. The vehicles are pretty fun to pilot/drive, but if you are a helicopter, do not get your hopes up of staying in the air that long.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								As an Early Access game, this is amazing. With tons of customization options and the handful of Vehicles to choose from; It's great!However, I am having bugs with Private Matches as I cannot create a Private Match for me and my Friends because It will not switch from Public to Private. Also, as I am planning on doing, I would like to play the game without Steam, but the Standalone copy cannot connect to my RCF Login from the Steam Version; so I will be using the Steam Version for the Time-Being.With all the Content and the obvious effort put into it; this game is amazing especially for a Free-To-Play Game. The Combat System is somewhat unique when compared to Call of Duty, and the EXP system is a lot more fun to me. To put it simply, I like this game and I hope that there will be more unlockable maps to choose from in the future!Controls: 8/10Graphics: 9/10Music/Sound: 6/10 (There really isn't a whole lot of music, But the sounds are pretty authentic when it comes to the Gunshots.)Gameplay: Fun, however does get boring after a few matches 9/10Average: 8/10

content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Do not get this game. The graphics on ultra are not that enjoyable, the servers are not created well enough, there are some people that cheat the game and give themselves god mode, infinite ammo, or invisibility. I played the game for less than 30 minutes and I ran into a god mode hacker. I do not hate this game, but I do not recommend it. It is free, though. I do not want to sway anyone, but definitely try the game out if you do not believe me. There are some alright aspects, though. The vehicles are pretty fun to pilot/drive, but if you are a helicopter, do not get your hopes up of staying in the air that long.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is a sorry excuse for an FPS.The voice acting is downright horrible... but hilarious. The training mission has the best ♥♥♥♥ing voice actor ever. He forgets his accents sometimes, it's so quality! And we can't forget that infamous "ugh" when you or an enemy dies.The gameplay is forgettable standard FPS gameplay. Aim, shoot, and your gun goes up a bit. It tried to be Call of Duty with vehicles, but for some reason I can't test them because there are no vehicular maps available for me to play at the time of this review. Maybe that could've made the game better.The sounds are really bad. Environmental, sure, they're okay. Guns? They sound like peashooters.The networking is alright. In the pitiful time I played this game, I found no errrors in hitboxes that I noticed.The graphics are okay. It's a F2P game, I didn't expect it to have good graphics. Needs some optimization, thoug.hOverall, the game is a 6/10 (AT THE TIME OF THIS REVIEW). Could it be better? Yeah. If it's released like this, it's going to be really, REALLY bad. I believe that Rocketeer Games Studio could hammer out the rough edges. P.S.: Oh, and get rid of the god awful excuse of a pay system. I am not going to pay for parachutes, grenades, or that sort. Cosmetic items would be way better imho.

												How i missed Red Crucible 2, with it's old mechanics (no fall damage, infinite ammo) and fun, i played it almost every day, but then it became Red Crucible Firestorm, i dint mind at first, because Red Crucible 2 was still there, it was then when Rocketeer ♥♥♥♥ed up and deleted red crucible 2 all together, only transfering your items to firestorm.This game did not innovate in any way from Red Crucible 2, in fact, it got worse.These are the new bad things i learned from recently playing: Your armor is pure decoration now, it used to give you extra health, now a double tap in the foot with a pistol will bring you down as if it were a granade exploding in your mouth. Then there are the premium weapons, straight upgrades to everything with cool modifications, all of which cost the in-game premium currency (clever way of stealing your money without refunds) called Coins, it costs a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of coins to buy one of these premium weapons and the coins themselves are everything but cheap.This game is completely ruined.EDIT: You may see that i don't have a lot of playtime, this is because i did not play Red Crucible 2 via steam.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								There are of course bugs and glitches, as with any early access game, but they aren't game-breaking or even all to disruptive to the actual gameplay. At the moment, it can seem a little pay-to-win, but in my opinion, it's not. It is still in early access, and there still needs to be some balancing done, like the cost of the weapons. It does seem a lot like CoD, but it still has most of its design and features grounded in original ideas. I did play some of the early editions, not on Steam, and they honestly seemed more in-depth than this one, but there is so much potential here. Overall, here's what I have to say about this game:Pros:-Simple, but fun-Easy to learn-decent graphics for early accessCons:-Pay-to-win-Controls feel clunky-One person would dominate pretty easily from some positions

Early Access Review
								The game has pretty much been ruined. Red Crucible 2 was just one of those fun browser games that were quite enjoyable but now that they're released Red Crucible Firestorm I feel as if all the fun has been taken out and replaced with an option to pay for absolutely everything. The default guns are more or less useless against the guns of those we call 'Wallet Warriors'.If you simply removed the option to pay for guns and instead made the game $5, I'm pretty sure more people would enjoy it.Overall I'm sick of P2W games so I guess if you still choose to play this game, don't expect too much.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is unchanged from the crappy unity browser FPS I played 7 years ago. It looks slightly better than it did, in the same way saying this pile of sh*t is slightly shinier, but it is unbalanced as all hell. The basic pistol is OP. I was able to charge into enemy terretory and only died when I ran out of pistol ammo, which is limited as all hell. One-two reloads in both the primary and secondary in a war game? That was done so that one would be compelled to buy a ammo pouch using real money. Bought weapons are so much better than basic guns. All in all, it could be ok if the F2P model was DRAMATICALLY reworked.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								RD:F is a FPS on a large scale, similar the popular franchise "Battlefield". However, gameplay is not always clear and can be confusing for the first-timer. Controls of extremely vague, if you are not already accustomed to "General Controls" (i.e W.A.S.D to move). Economy is completely reliant of near months of gameplay for one of many weapons, skins, etc.. There are balancing issues with certain vehicles. (i.e APCs are near useless because of considerably weak armor and one tank can destroy entire teams, without much punishment.).This game obviously needs a little bit more work, some graphical and auditorial tune-ups, balancing on a large scale, and easier user interface. I do not recommend this game because of the reasons I've listed above.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have played Red Crucible 2 for a while now, and it has a similar feel. I feel like this game has potential, but there's a lot missing. The biggest concern is microtransactions. Microtransactions are te bane of video gaming, and I would rather pay 30 bucks for the game, and when the company takes off into AAA market, I would invest more into the games. That being said, I understand the microtransactions are basically your easiest way to make money, but if your willing to overhaul the microtransactions, then at least remove them from full release and establish a static price. Graphically, this game is also generations back, and I would like to see visual improvements, if not, optimization. Controls are a bit wonky as well and the gui and hud are very hard to manipulate. If you want positive reinforcement, I love the maps. They appear to be revamps of red crucible 2 maps, but good none the less. I also like the vehicle selection, and this game honestly has a lot of great gameplay mechanics. But there is that missing aspect of refining in the game at the moment. Overall, my rating is:The Good:MapsMechanicsGameplayThe Bad:MicrotransactionsVisualsMenus and hudsAll in all, I have to give this game a thumbs down, and I only say this because it just needs to be improved, and I do expect that it will considering the game is in early release, and I might boot the game up again on next major update.

Unity back in Unity 3 times didnt had a proper animation system.For the graphics, i maybe know WTF is wrong buuuuuut im not the RC:F's dev am i?This game is about strategy on battlfield. About thinking FAST. About real ACTION. It's NOT a RUN'n'GUN like Children Online Daycare......... oh..... wait a sec.... oh! i got it. Call Of Duty.Point is you must get into the game! Most of bad reviews had actually less an hour. What do you expect??? 0.5 Hrs of playing and becoming a pro? REALLY?????Point is im going to sort this out so......Pros +:+ Good Gamplay+ Good balancing (ill explain this)+ GBAP - F2P+ Not a bad learning curve.- F2P (Ill explain later)Cons - :- Behold the return of the ATARI! If he is a Newbie then killing him will be so EZ KILL, u know, and also if you are pro and so adapted to your gun, Hey, say hello to rampage with M16!This game is about GAMEPLAY. about ACTION. about STRATEGY.5/10 - ♥♥♥♥♥iest graphics ever. content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now I have only played this game for 20 minutes. You'll find out why below. Considering it's free to play it's not too bad on the surface. It's fairly basic, has a very 2004-esque feel to it gameplay and graphics wise. Could have been good for a few cheap laughs or to pass some time. My major problem is that it runs like crap. I have an i3-4160 and a GTX750Ti, and the game chugs even on 1080p medium settings. For a game that looks like this, that's totally unacceptable. I can run Advanced Warfare/Battlefield 4 on high no problems. But this....I have to play at low settings to get 60fps, even though it looks like a game from 10 years ago.

												I donno what to say.Look guys.If you whant a "hey look! RUN'N'GUN!" SH*T, then you are wrong. As for the graphics and physics well.... based on some technincal stuff this thing was made using Unity Engine 3, and guess wut? Unity back in Unity 3 times didnt had a proper animation system.For the graphics, i maybe know WTF is wrong buuuuuut im not the RC:F's dev am i?This game is about strategy on battlfield. About thinking FAST. About real ACTION. It's NOT a RUN'n'GUN like Children Online Daycare......... oh..... wait a sec.... oh! i got it. Call Of Duty.Point is you must get into the game! Most of bad reviews had actually less an hour. What do you expect??? 0.5 Hrs of playing and becoming a pro? REALLY?????Point is im going to sort this out so......Pros +:+ Good Gamplay+ Good balancing (ill explain this)+ GBAP - F2P+ Not a bad learning curve.- F2P (Ill explain later)Cons - :- Behold the return of the ATARI! Behold the lord of the ♥♥♥♥♥iest graphics. Honestly, WTF? Welcome to 2002- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ physics- Old Engine- ♥♥♥♥♥ies optimisations EVER- ♥♥♥♥♥♥ support. If he is a Newbie then killing him will be so EZ KILL, u know, and also if you are pro and so adapted to your gun, Hey, say hello to rampage with M16!This game is about GAMEPLAY. about ACTION. about STRATEGY.5/10 - ♥♥♥♥♥iest graphics ever. content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm all for Indie developers, but not for this one...If there is a game I can compare it to it would be Battlefield 1942. Is it because it is set in WW2? Nope.Graphicly and animation like it would be closest to Battlefield 1942, a game that came out in 2002, aka 13 years ago.I can understand that if you are a new player in the development game that you don't have money for a great engine and people working for you, but come on! There are so many possibilities in this day!Now if this was truly free to play, I wouldn't have such complaints about it and I would mess around on it with friends, but this game has micro transactions, it has packs you can buy.Sure it's great to support a new developer, but not if you can't even make a game look better then bloody Battlefield 1942! You can buy support on the battlefield by buying packs, you can buy new weapons to outgun your oponent, that is a big no no.I would not suggest this game to anyone, I know people will think you need to play more then you did to rate a game, but this is just lazy cash grabbery.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												/edit (01/02/16)Okay. So actually after a few more hours I've found a few answers to the problems I wrote about initially in this "review" (the single sentence at the end). However, I'm still sure there better free shooters than this available. Team Fortress 2 and Tribes: Ascend immediately come to mind though they're quite different games. Warface shares more similarities and is a good example of a greater game if not only due to the solid core mechanics such as movement and aim.For a start, it wasn't immediately obvious that early new weapons actually didn't take 50000 honour each to obtain as indicated by the "store" tab (of which you can earn around 50-150 per match) and instead they can be purchased for less than 1000 each from the "unlock" tab. I recall starting with 2500 honour, so not bad. This includes the entire range of weaponry from snipers to rocket launchers, so you actually don't miss out too much. And four of us had glossed over this before I eventually found it.Obviously there is still the issue of having higher cost/level guns doing more damage (and you can also upgrade each gun?) and the consumables such as grenades, airstrikes and medkits need replenishing through purchases (though there is a chance to get some through daily/level rewards). I haven't tried the boosts to stats, but I haven't noticed anybody else with them either apart from one person running at ridiculous speed and therefore will have no appreciation for their existence. At least a rocket launcher is a new solution to the vehicles that still have poor movement.Another thing I quickly realised was the lack of maps (3) until also discovered in the "unlock" tab was that there were another three to unlock very cheaply at 100 honour each. However, the percentage of people playing on them was about 5%. That is to say, one server for each. This may show how very few others have found this unlock feature.The maps are honestly probably one of the strongest points of the game. Instead of the map itself, what makes them irritating is the placement of spawn points and that some routes can be linear and predictable. Spawn points are very enclosed which makes spawn lockdown (not quite spawnkilling) fairly common. Also it makes controlling territory very unrewarding as all progress is lost after death. Forgiveable with the smaller maps, due to the spawn lockdown problem, but very labourious on the larger maps. Also glass that can't be shot through. Yeah.But the main problem is none of this. It is simply the core gameplay mechanics. Sure, the movement is average, the objectives are average, the vehicles are.. average? The problem is the shooting is bad. In my opinion the best strategy in gunplay should not be to jump around corners and unloading. And this combined with having superior guns unlocked with more time spent on the game is what decides matches. Especially on smaller maps. Longer range is awful due to the hundreds of invisible walls scattered over the environment. Random bits of cover where you can still see your enemy will stop your bullets from reaching them. It happens constantly, and is why the above strategy is preferred. Also the draw distance means you can't even see people at a higher range, as well as there being a constant "sway" when aiming with a sniper rifle with no way to steady it whereas each other gun has no such thing.However, even with all these negatives the game has been a laugh with a few friends discovering all of the hilarity in the animations, vehicles and knife combat and has become a bit of a callback. The negatives at least made the game less serious and opened it up to find the fun hidden inside. I still can't recommend it./edit2 (03/02/16)Good update, adding a great new map and gamemode, as well as better mechanics for destroying vehicles. Also extra settings and bug fixes and guff.I'm starting to kind of like this game./edit2/edit3 (17/02/16)Can't join people lower level than you?Armour exists and shouldn't./edit3Original review below:/editPerfect if you want to play 200 games to unlock each gun while you fight on a battlefield with randomly boosted players who will have extra sprint speed and weapon damage etcetera for the next 20 minutes; where you are given a set amount of grenades, mines, medkits and airstrikes before you have to pay for new ones from the ingame store; and where on each respawn you mindlessly rush at each other with vehicles and spam click to kill anyone who isn't in one while you either flip onto the side of the vehicle or clip through another one.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												/edit (01/02/16)Okay. So actually after a few more hours I've found a few answers to the problems I wrote about initially in this "review" (the single sentence at the end). However, I'm still sure there better free shooters than this available. Team Fortress 2 and Tribes: Ascend immediately come to mind though they're quite different games. Warface shares more similarities and is a good example of a greater game if not only due to the solid core mechanics such as movement and aim.For a start, it wasn't immediately obvious that early new weapons actually didn't take 50000 honour each to obtain as indicated by the "store" tab (of which you can earn around 50-150 per match) and instead they can be purchased for less than 1000 each from the "unlock" tab. I recall starting with 2500 honour, so not bad. This includes the entire range of weaponry from snipers to rocket launchers, so you actually don't miss out too much. And four of us had glossed over this before I eventually found it.Obviously there is still the issue of having higher cost/level guns doing more damage (and you can also upgrade each gun?) and the consumables such as grenades, airstrikes and medkits need replenishing through purchases (though there is a chance to get some through daily/level rewards). I haven't tried the boosts to stats, but I haven't noticed anybody else with them either apart from one person running at ridiculous speed and therefore will have no appreciation for their existence. At least a rocket launcher is a new solution to the vehicles that still have poor movement.Another thing I quickly realised was the lack of maps (3) until also discovered in the "unlock" tab was that there were another three to unlock very cheaply at 100 honour each. However, the percentage of people playing on them was about 5%. That is to say, one server for each. This may show how very few others have found this unlock feature.The maps are honestly probably one of the strongest points of the game. Instead of the map itself, what makes them irritating is the placement of spawn points and that some routes can be linear and predictable. Spawn points are very enclosed which makes spawn lockdown (not quite spawnkilling) fairly common. Also it makes controlling territory very unrewarding as all progress is lost after death. Forgiveable with the smaller maps, due to the spawn lockdown problem, but very labourious on the larger maps. Also glass that can't be shot through. Yeah.But the main problem is none of this. It is simply the core gameplay mechanics. Sure, the movement is average, the objectives are average, the vehicles are.. average? The problem is the shooting is bad. In my opinion the best strategy in gunplay should not be to jump around corners and unloading. And this combined with having superior guns unlocked with more time spent on the game is what decides matches. Especially on smaller maps. Longer range is awful due to the hundreds of invisible walls scattered over the environment. Random bits of cover where you can still see your enemy will stop your bullets from reaching them. It happens constantly, and is why the above strategy is preferred. Also the draw distance means you can't even see people at a higher range, as well as there being a constant "sway" when aiming with a sniper rifle with no way to steady it whereas each other gun has no such thing.However, even with all these negatives the game has been a laugh with a few friends discovering all of the hilarity in the animations, vehicles and knife combat and has become a bit of a callback. The negatives at least made the game less serious and opened it up to find the fun hidden inside. I still can't recommend it./edit2 (03/02/16)Good update, adding a great new map and gamemode, as well as better mechanics for destroying vehicles. Also extra settings and bug fixes and guff.I'm starting to kind of like this game./edit2/edit3 (17/02/16)Can't join people lower level than you?Armour exists and shouldn't./edit3Original review below:/editPerfect if you want to play 200 games to unlock each gun while you fight on a battlefield with randomly boosted players who will have extra sprint speed and weapon damage etcetera for the next 20 minutes; where you are given a set amount of grenades, mines, medkits and airstrikes before you have to pay for new ones from the ingame store; and where on each respawn you mindlessly rush at each other with vehicles and spam click to kill anyone who isn't in one while you either flip onto the side of the vehicle or clip through another one.

content:

Early Access Review
								I'm all for Indie developers, but not for this one...If there is a game I can compare it to it would be Battlefield 1942. Is it because it is set in WW2? Nope.Graphicly and animation like it would be closest to Battlefield 1942, a game that came out in 2002, aka 13 years ago.I can understand that if you are a new player in the development game that you don't have money for a great engine and people working for you, but come on! There are so many possibilities in this day!Now if this was truly free to play, I wouldn't have such complaints about it and I would mess around on it with friends, but this game has micro transactions, it has packs you can buy.Sure it's great to support a new developer, but not if you can't even make a game look better then bloody Battlefield 1942! You can buy support on the battlefield by buying packs, you can buy new weapons to outgun your oponent, that is a big no no.I would not suggest this game to anyone, I know people will think you need to play more then you did to rate a game, but this is just lazy cash grabbery.

content:

Early Access Review
								It's got a lot of potential for a browser game. And it is also one of the only Free-to-Play FPS games on Steam to not force you to make an account on another website just so they can spam your e-mail. It's also not really pay to win because the weapons you get are half decent and everybody else seems to have never played an FPS before. The cons are that almost everybody you're in a match with is an idiot. You'll see plenty of helicopters stuck in the corners of maps as their pilots spam the chat with "help". It is basically a buggy broken Battlefield on Unity.

												Stilton, Pear and Walnut bread(Makes one small loaf)Ingredients:500g Strong White Bread Flour10g Salt7g satchet instant yeast20g Unsalted Butter, diced and softened320ml water200g Stilton Cheese100g Walnut Peices1 pear, peeled, cored and diced1. Tip the flour into a large bowl. Add the salt to one side, yeast into the other. Add the butter and 3/4ths of the water, then turn the mixture with the fingers of one hand. Add the remaining water a little at a time, continuing to mix untill all the flour is taken in and the dough is soft and sticky; you may not need all the water.2. Coat the work surface with a little oil to prevent the dough sticking. Turn out the dough and knead for at least 5 mins, until smooth and no longer sticky. Lightly oil a bowl, return the dough to it, and cover with cling film. Put in fride for an hour, so it has doubled in size.3. Line a baking tray with grease-proof paper. Scrape the dough out of the bowl and fold it inwards again and again until all the air is knocked out and it is smooth. Add the stilton, walnut and pear peices to the dough and work them in well.4. Shape the dough into a rectangle 30 cm long, roll it up into a sausage, then flatten it out again and roll it up a bit tighter this time. Tuck the edges under and neaten the loaf by rolling the edges to taper them slightly. Put the dogh on the baking tray with greaseproof paperwith the join underneath. Place the tray in a plastic bag and leave to prove for about 40 mins, until the loaf has doubled in size. Heat the oven too 200C, or Gas 6.5. Just before baking, gently rub flour over the loaf, then make deep diagonal cuts alo9ng the top, first in one direction, then the other, to make a criss-cross pattern. Bake for about 30 mins, until well-risen and golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.
